campaign.story:
We’re here to put a dent in the charging experience. Phone charging has become one of the most essential task in everyday life, so put a little effort & investment on it, would results huge happiness.
VoltBot is designed to improve charging experience.
PLAY

When your adapter is closer to you, your data cable can reach further. This will ensure that your devices can stay within a comfortable operation zone.
What is a good charging experience? You can move the phone and operate it freely while charging.
Traditional charger have to be plugged into power socket, and power socket carrys AC electricity, which is dangerous to humen. It results that people have to reach out for a charger, but a charger never reach out for people.
The DC power which VoltBot use, is completely safe, which means abolutely NO shock harzard. Our creator will perform eating it in the video at the bottom of this page. No longer need to keep distance from chargers.
Overnight charging on bed? It might be a good news for those who likes to play phone before falling asleep.  
1. LCD 
VoltBot provides a visual charging experience:
Display dynamic charging voltage & current. 
Display real-time charging speed(power circle). 
Display quick charging state. 
Display history data, curve.
It is exciting to watch electricity streaming into your devices. Look into the details of charging.
2. APP 
VoltBot has an APP. VoltBot will broadcast a WiFi hotspot named 'VoltBot', the phone can join the hotspot and talk to VoltBot with APP.
With APP, curves of charging current can be observed, with which the actual battery capacity can be calculated. 
VoltBot consists of 4 charging engines, providing 4 independent charging channels. Each channel can be matched to the best quick charge protocol. With quick charge, VoltBot can accelerate charging speed up to 70~75%.
VoltBot supports quick charging protocols, including QC3.0/QC2.0, FCP, AFC, SFCP, Apple 2.4A, BC1.2, PumpExpress and samsung 2A.
Estimate speed ups: (examples, not all listed)
iPhone6+/6s+/7/8/X can speed up 70% than small white charger. 
iPhone6s can speed up 30% than original charger. 
Android devices have too many types, please refer to manufacture's manuals.
Full support of Android devices. 
Full support of Apple devices.
Full support of other phones, such as BlackBerry, Moto, HTC, Nokia and Windows Phone.
Full support of other USB devices, such as PAD, PDA, mp3, earphone, bracelet, and etc.
How many adapters have you collected? 10? 20? Hmm...  
You'll no longer need to count, because VoltBot can replace them all. VoltBot can give you any voltage through 2.5V~12V, and this ability even ensures VoltBot a good tool to conduct physics experiment.
VoltBot can be phone charger or pad charger.
 VoltBot can also be adapter of wireless router.
VoltBot can connect to cigar-lighter plug-in, directly utilizing power generated by car.
The benefits of having charger near bed is obvious. Because messages and calls arrive now and then, if we do overnight charging near bed, it would be easier for us to reach out for phone.
There are some advantageous factors of VoltBot to be placed near bed. 
VoltBot equipped environmental light sensor to auto adjust its backlight power. So its screen will go dim when you fall asleep. And a side key is implemented, you can also switch the screen on/off mannually by pressing it (same as phone). Auto-Backlight is default on. However, some people may have special tastes, wishing screen to be shining in the night. Just use the APP or web-browser, configuration interface is there.
Left: Auto-Backlight Off                                   Right: Auto-Backlight On
We also implement Auto-Cut-Off function to further protect your battery. You can find the demo video in the bottom of this page.
VoltBot brings you into a world of physics hobby and electronics DIY. Under DC Supply Mode, DC voltage within range from 2.50V to 12.50V can be synthesized immediately. It can be used to power your gadgets and home-made circuits. Real-time current displayed on VoltBot's LCD and power curves monitored by its APP helps you to analyze your gadgets' working condition. Compared to a conventional DC power supply, VoltBot is much smaller.
 1. Smart Power Supply
VoltBot is a smart DC Power Supply. It has 4 independent output channels. Each channel has a high-speed digital power engine inside. Those engines provide low ripples and fast transitions. Their efficiency is optimized to achieve low self-heat and high stability. With converters converting USB plug-in into dual-screw jacks or banana jacks, it is possible to use VoltBot the same way like a traditional DC power supply.
Real-time voltage and current is printed on LCD. Power curves can be read with APP.
2. Easy to setup
Easily switching between Charger Mode or DC Supply Mode. Beneath DC Supply Mode, VoltBot is always ready to output the voltage exactly as you tapped-in.
Web Page 
VoltBot embeds a page server inside. This feature eables you access VoltBot by most devices such as Pad, laptop, or Phone. No APP installation is compelled. With this feature, we guarantee your VoltBot will be accessable 100 years later, and can be accessed globaly.
Touch-Key
There are 4 touch key designed on upper edge of VoltBot, you can use those key to setup VoltBot quickly, toggle between common voltages(3.3V 4.0V 5.0V 9.0V). A demo video of touch-key is uploaded at the bottom of this page.
App 
The App (VoltRobot) also has configuration interface.
The volume of VoltBot is only 3% of the traditional Power Supply. It’s portable and saves a lot of desktop space. VoltBot provides a perfect solution for common user: electronic fans, DIY makers, and students.
To create an experiment comprised of serveral electronic gadgets, one big problem is that different gadgets require different power inputs.VoltBot will fit the gadgets' needs.
VoltBot has Wi-Fi connectivity, which meas it can be accessed not only in one room, but also globally. With Internet status and control of every power channel can be accessed remotely.
VoltBot also has UART interface, you can directly embed it into in-field system as a module, controlling and monitoring the power with your Arduino, Raspberry Pi, Embedded System and industrial controller.
DIYers and Electronic Fans
Get rid of a bunch of adapters.
Engineers and Geeks
Build your full-digital power scheme, monitor the power status of every rail.
Maintenance Men
VoltBot can save workspace and can be used to diagnose&test multiple devices simultaneously.
Students and Educators
DC inputs is safe for children to conduct physics experiments.
 Take VoltBot out of its box, place it on your desk, and connect its power adatper.
1. Get a pair of velcro stickers. (included in VoltBot's Mount Kit)
2. Stick VoltBot to the vertical surface.
3. Connect power adatper.
Front Panel: Install with a magnet mount. Just the same as mounting phone. (Which in Mount Kit)
Back Seats: Just follow the upper instruction to Stick VoltBot to the back of front seat.
Power: Connect VoltBot to car's power system. Recommend connect to Cigar-Ligter socket with a Cigar-to-DC cable.(Which in Mount Kit)
Connect phone into any one of 4 USB ports, done.
The place where VoltBot is developed. There are more picutres showing historical prototypes of VoltBot in the gallery.
                     Interfaces
                    Assembly (Note. Newest version only has 4 USB sockets)
                        Specifications & Fuctions.
                     Meaning of Icons on Screen
                   Schematics of VoltBot
Our creator, Chris is a master of EE, graduated from Peking University, the top university in China. He was a major hardware engineer in an MRI team, and proficient in designing, assembly, testing, and reparing processes.
 VoltBot is built from two different materials. Yellow part is ABS, Grey part is TPE. TPE has anti-impact property plus a perfect tactile impression.
NOTE: Before pledging accessories, please take a look of FAQ tab of this page.
 1. Engineer Kit
The purpose of Engineer Kit is to use VoltBot as 2.5~12V power adapter or adjustable DC power supply. If you want any fuctions described in Pro Features, an engineer kit is nessesary.
 2. Mount Kit
The purpose of Mount Kit is to install VoltBot on vertical surface or in cars. Velcro stickers is purposed to install VoltBot on vertical surface, such as walls, bed, sofa. Magnet mount is purposed to install VoltBot on front panel in driver cabin. Cigar-to-DC cable is purposed to draw DC power directly from cigar-ligter plug-in.
Campain Success (10K HK dollar): A USB data-cable is gifted. (Lightening, Micro, Type-C optional) 
150K HK dollar: Dual-Screw Convertor. (Image in upper section)
200K HK dollar: USB Voltage & Current Meter
300K HK dollar: USB Lighter
350K HK dollar: Cigar-to-DC cable and upgrading Mount Kit
 Here is a letter from one of our backer (publicity permitted):
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Now cut-off function has been added. you can see the demo video in next section.
If you have your own expectations towards VoltBot, DO SEND IT to us please. 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1. Chirs is eating it.
PLAY

2. Quick charging demo
PLAY

3. Installation on car (also applied to vertical surface)
PLAY

 4. Touch-key Demo
Note: the flicker and blur on LCD is due to the resonace between camera and LCD, the actual visual effect is the same as the up-right corner.  
PLAY

 5. Auto-Shutdown Demo
We got two shutdown option: 1. Current below 0.5A; 2. 3 Hours passed.
The former would remove the last half of CV charging process (do more good to battery). The later will keeps all CV charging process, (less good but more capacity), which suits overnight charging.
PLAY

 6. 60Watts Charging Power
Large power but low heating. Because of its high efficiency, there is no need to use heat-sink organ inside VoltBot.
PLAY

 7. Observing Dynamic Power Consumption with VoltBot

updates.update_content:
Hi Backers,
We released a new version of firmware, together with APP. Those features are added.
1.Limited the maximum voltage for wire-compensation to 5.5V
2. Removed the touch-key lock-down after continuously three times of wrong code inputting.

Hi backers,
I am very proud here to announce a new accessory for VoltBot. It's name is Voltage Extender Kit.
Here are some demos:
VoltBot is outputing 36V with the help of a cheap adatper.

Hi Backers,

We release a new firmware version 07082019 and a new App version 1.10.
We have done these modifications in the newest firmware:
1. Pulsed mode.

Hi Backers,

Sorry for trouble you again, because I have missed out one important thing.
We have updated our server from HTTP into HTTPS. This makes old Android App cannot fit in.

Hi Backers,

We are here to share some news with you.
1. A new toy, desktop stand.
If you need it, $7 to paypal:xiongzechong@163.com

updates.update_userinfo: Current Control Mode and Free Touch-Key Options
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers,

We unlocked current control mode and now VoltBot could be used as a battery charger now.
It could also help to power or test a LED to which current control would be better.

Hi Backers,

We are very sorry for a long period we didn't realize that we have one defeated calibration module in our factory.
It could impact some of your VoltBots, to have terrible precisions.

Newest Version 14062019.
Changes:
1. Better Guidance for Touch-Keys, won't cause puzzles any more.
2. Big warning will be displayed when a channel is under DC power mode and the voltage is higher than 5.5. In this situation, normal USB devices shouldn't be plugged-in.

updates.update_userinfo: New Features: Touch-Key and Banana Kit
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers,
We have a little news to share with you.
1. New firmware update: unlock any voltage setting with touch-key. After you entered DC Power Mode by taping 1324-1-2, you will see the is an "Other Voltage" option now. And the IP of VoltBot could be seen by taping 3421-3 now.

Hi backers,
We updated the user manual to match the operation methods in the newest firmware version.
And we improved some narrative to make things more clear.
You could download it with this link.

comments.content: See the discussion started by David Solomon a few messages down, others have encountered the same problem, there's a (possible) fix described there.

I tired use 3 mobile phone and desktop wifi connect, just one mobile can connect the VoltBot and disconnect and reconnect endless loop.
Thanks

I had a similar problem with glitches, the Voltbot restarted and beeped several times, and all four channels showed a current output of 9.99A. Tried restarting and got the same thing, it was only after I left it unplugged for about ten minutes that they showed a normal value, however random channels are now glitching in and out of 9.99A mode. People may want to hold off updating...

Followup post, setting "Suppress tiny current" as suggested by @David Solomon seems to have fixed it, it hasn't glitched/beeped for about ten minutes now so keeping fingers crossed. Voltbot devs, I think this is something that may need to be fixed in the firmware...

For the Voltbot devs, I think this option has actually introduced a problem rather than fixing anything. Without "Suppress tiny current" the Voltbot glitches constantly. With "Suppress tiny current" the glitching goes away, but it still shows tiny current blips like it did before the "Suppress tiny current" option was added. In other words with "Suppress tiny current" set the behaviour is the same as it was before the current FW update. Without "Suppress tiny current" set the Voltbot glitches constantly.
Heh, well that would make the updates a lot more useful! It would even make me glad you can still update the device.

If we add the 2 numbers we pick to the end, that should help everyone connect to the VoltBot vs Cloudfares website advertising its new service. @Apple, am I correct in this fix? Or anyone else. Can the newly-added cut-off function be disabled via a control setting? Some phones and similar devices know when they're plugged into a charger and draw power from the charger instead of the built-in battery. I've seen phones that do this, leave them plugged into a power bank and they'll eventually drain the power bank while apparently doing nothing. If the power is cut off by the charger when it thinks the phone is charged then they'll presumably constantly cycle on and off the charging state. In other words it's possible the phone and charger will end up fighting each other over who controls the power supply.

campaign.story:
EleksTube is a RGB retro full color simulation glow tube electronic clock.
Due to the increasing appeal of The Glow Discharge Tube. More and more people want there own Glow Tube Clock. But The Glow Tube has been out of production for a long time, since the demise of the soviet union. So it's hard to get a new Glow Tube now. 
Today, EleksMaker has brought an entirely new design of the RGB retro full color simulation glow tube electronic clock.
EleksTube uses an innovative way to simulate the reality of the glow tube, which can connect your computer to change its color with your mind. And add RGB full-color discoloration function.Fully support Windows/Mac system.
EleksTube provides a variety of choices for you, We have 4 bit black and white acrylic / 6 units bit clock ElekTube kit, and 4 bit / 6 bit bamboo material ElekTube clock suite.
And creative push out single bit version EleksTube which compatible with most of the full bit EleksTube functions. Single bit version EleksTube also have acrylic version and bamboo version. 
They all have technology black metal anodic alumina alloy base and the integrated main controller and 1600W color Tube lamp board developed by EleksMaker. Add new passion and creativity to your artistic creation.
When the such idea that retro clock project produced. we feel very excited. 
Our EleksMaker Studio is a focus on the desktop CNC devices and embedded development team.We have push out several popular desktop laser engraving / drawing machine, and embedded motherboard. So we have a lot of experience of research and development in technology equipment, and we immediately decided to use our own style to make this interesting idea into products that everyone can buy.
Although only having a single digit display, Tube One easily shows the time by displaying numbers one after the other. For example, 15:48pm would display as ‘1… 5… 4… 8’. This provides a very simple and natural way to read the time.
You can choose your favorite color in every mode. EleksTube support rainbow gradation and a variety of display modes.
PLAY

Then our hardware engineer has completed the integration of PCB main controller board, a RGB Light PCB demo version and delivered to our factory to make a early version. We tested dozens of tube pipes design production plan, and ultimately make the display design of the best effect.After hundreds of times continuous improvement and tests. Finally we push out the best version of EleksTube.
Our software engineers began to design the EleksTube hardware driver and PC application from zero. EleksTube communication protocol, control protocol and model switch algorithm. Software engineers completed the application for Windows and then transplantation platform to Mac OS.Make the EleksTube from one of our ideas, become so gorgeous and real equipment.
In the future, EleksTube has Infinite species possibility. We will open source our communication protocol API, everyone can experience the joy of DIY EleksTube. Everyone can customize your EleksTube, we will constantly update the official software and firmware for EleksTube, and add new functions in further. We will release our latest research results at the EleksMaker official forum. 
 Thank you for your support
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have been working closely and building up a strong relationship with our suppliers since the past few years. as other projects may encounter supply break problems, we have confidence to ensure stock and lead-times are within our production requirements; and ensure all the components have been testing and met the highest standard.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
For those who knew the first version of
Gyroscope Sensor V2 for FPV Head Tracking, Robotics and More
                                    Here is the new Iota V2!
New V2 version
Even more perfect for FPV head tracking, robotics, movement control and why not video games. Based on ATmega328P microcontroller, the 3 axis motion sensor gyroscope allows you to track the movement of the head or arm and replicate it to servos. For Do It Yourself (DIY) home project lover who dreams of doing a head tracking system FPV themselves cheaply. 
This system has been specially designed for DIY in electronics or robotics for students to explore electronics or who want their own system, but are less comfortable with advanced programming of accelerometers. You can use one or more axes (X, Y, Z) independently. According to your needs.
New in V2:
Lighter. Only 4 grams!
Smaller. Only 2,5 cm x 2,5 cm (1" x 1")
Cheaper! Look at rewards starting at only $18 USD!!
PPM output possibility for RC remote control
Only 1 inch x 1 inch size (2,5 cm x 2,5 cm)
New feature - Now with PPM output signal 
You can connect the servos directly on the module or use the PPM output to connect into the training port of your RC remote control.
PPM formatted output signal
 Project is still in progress
At this moment, I can't show you a fully functional prototype. A small batch of PCB (about 150 pcs) is now in manufacturing process. It is for final prototype and the first batch reward.
Work in progress
Fine pitch soldering needs microscope
 Datasheet
You can download the datasheet here
 About mhpro.net
Developer in electronics offers its services. With more than 22 years experience in IT and experienced do-it-yourself in various fields, I specialize in the realization of digital electronics custom projects. 
If you need help with your project, or if you have an idea that you want to achieve, I may be able to help you. I've been successful campaign twice here. I sold my products around the world and I am always looking for new challenges for the next ...
Don't forget to like my facebook page!
Take a look on mhpro.net web site. You will see more about other projects.
Featured on
    http://kickingitforward.org

campaign.story:
OMNIBOARD is is a versatile, portable electronics workbench. I have created the OMNIBOARD to make electronics easier and more affordable, to put in your hands tools which are rarely accessible for hobbyists while still being easy to use for the beginners and powerful enough for the experts.
OMNIBOARD can be used as the USB device, connected to the computer or as a standalone device (limited functionality: oscilloscope, basic waveform generator, voltmeter, power supply & clock source).
OMNIBOARD is the full electronics workbench
It is not only a three channel 10MSPS oscilloscope. 
THE OMNIBOARD is the:
✅ Oscilloscope ☣ 3 channels, 10MSPS, 64k samples
✅ Waveform Generator ☣ 5MSPS, advanced software
✅ Power Supply ☣ 5 Voltages, 5.0V, 3.3V, 2.5V, 1.8V, -5V ∑ 1A
✅ Voltmeter ☣ 4 Channels
✅ AVR ISP programmer ☣ AVRdude compatible
✅ ARM Programmer & Debugger ☣ SWD debugger and programmer
✅ Serial to USB Converter ☣ 1M Max speed
✅ 8MHz Clock Source ☣ Provide clock for your devices
✅ Frequency meter ☣ 10MHz, Duty cycle
✅ RLC + ESR meter ☣ Advanced RLC meter (extension card needed)
✅ 5x Programmable GPIO ports ☣ Control GPIO from your computer
✅ 5x PWM Ports ☣ USB to 5xPWM converter
✅ Diodes & Transistors tester ☣ Advanced features
✅ I2C to USB converter ☣ Program and debug I2C devices
✅ SPI to USB converter ☣ Program and debug SPI devices
✅ USART to USB converter ☣ Program, sniff and debug USART devices
*TFT screen is not included. Almost any Arduino shield format can be used.
Main features
Oscilloscope & waveform generator are packed with advanced features, many of which are not even available in more expensive products.
2xChannels -16.5 to 16.5V, third channel 0-3.3V.
Voltmeter works in both modes: standalone and USB. We have created a special micro application just for the voltmeter in the USB mode. It has some nice features such as: stay on top, hold results and configurable low pass filter to make displayed results more stable if needed.
Power Source: Any of the positive voltages can be delivered independently to the breadboard power rails. They are also available on the pin header on the top of the board.
 OMNIBORD is a AVR microcontroller ISP programmer and a CORTEX (ARM) SWD programmer and debugger. No additional hardware needed.
Serial to USB converter: (Virtual COM port). Separate COM port for the serial communication, not shared with other devices.
OMNIBOARD has 5 GPIO / PWM ports controlled by the software in the USB & standalone modes.
* RLC Meter - for full functionality requires the RLC Extension Board which accommodates the ZIFF socket and some passive elements. RLC Extension Board will be available after the Kickstarter campaign in our shop and as an Open Hardware project.
The I2C/SPI Host device is a powerful I2C & SPI bus host adapter through USB. It allows a developer to interface to the I2C/SPI devices and transfer serial messages using the I2C and SPI protocols, making development and debugging much easier.The I2C & SPI host adapters thremself cost in excess of $250
MODES OF OPERATION
BOARD LAYOUT
Optional TFT SCREEN
If the omniboard is used as standalone device a TFT display is needed. Almost any Arduino TFT touch shield can be used (the firmware supports most of the available chip sets). The shield is not included
 Stretch Goals
PLAY

campaign.story:
For seven years now, iA Writer has been used and loved by professional writers on Mac, iOS, and Android. iA Writer runs on Windows 7, 8 and 10. It comes with a custom installer. Everything is designed to make you focus on the text.
We believe in removing distractions, giving you a calm, focused writing space: We stripped away everything that might stand between you and how you feel so that you can write from the heart. This is how great writing gets started. We created focus mode. An experience where everything fades away. Everything but the sentence you are writing, the thought that you are expressing right now. Focus mode helps you dive into the flow.
Sentence Focus Mode
There's a powerful engine underneath the hood, but it never gets in your way: First, you write from the heart. Then you write with the head. There’s a time to edit, and a time to shape. 
Paragraph Focus Mode
iA Writer is a tool for the brave: When we are about to do something that is important, we are most likely to procrastinate. So we don’t need to face others and ultimately ourselves. We procrastinate to protect ourselves. We might get rejected. We might get no response. We might find out that we are not as great as we hope to be. This is why it so hard to start with that novel, publish that blog post, make that call, or write that proposal. The only way to fight that fear is focussing. Focussing no matter what. Focussing against all odds. Focus, get started, get it done. This needs courage. There is no app or tool that will give you courage. But there are environments that encourage distractions out. And there are environments that encourage you to focus. iA Writer is not about features, bells, and whistles, it is all about getting focused and getting started.
Night Mode
Every feature in iA Writer is designed to let you better focus on the text
Folding: Expand and compress the text below a headline so you can quickly switch between a structural and a detailed view 
Folding: Click headline to show and hide chapter text
Markdown: Lets you quickly format your writing without having to use your mouse and break your flow.
Focus Mode: Focus Mode dims everything but the current sentence, helping you stay in the flow. 
Type Writer Mode: Have your cursor vertically centered on the screen so you always see the sentence you are working on right ahead of you. 
Night Mode: iA Writer includes an inverted “light on dark” mode, perfect for writing at night. 
Full-Screen Mode: Give your writing the attention it deserves
Writing Goals: Set a goal in number of words/characters 
Writing Goals
Duo Spaced Font: Use iA Writer Duospace, a font optimized for writing.
iA Writer Duospace Font
Markdown Preview: Use the preview function to see how your text renders in a separate preview 
PDF Export: Export your text as a simple PDF
CSS Templates: If you use iA Writer for your business, you can now create custom templates for previewing, printing, and PDF export. The Windows templating logic is compatible with our existing templates.
Content Blocks: Embed pictures files, table files, and other plain text files…
“iA Writer creates a clean, simple and distraction-free writing environment for when you really need to focus on your words. It’s delightful to use"
"iA Writer is an example of how powerful simplicity and accessibility can be for creating commercially successful interfaces, applications or services. This is true even if you're a newbie up against the software world's leading heavyweights."
“iA Writer is all about textual production – writing this phrase, this sentence, this word at this moment."
“Writer has out-innovated Apple” —Fast Company
“Astonishingly simple. Everything goes away except for the writing experience.” —Stephen Fry, Comedian
"I’m a huge fan. I use IA Writer for all of my writing. Thank you for an exceptional product." – Biz Stone, co-founder Twitter
“My fellow Windows exiles: Do you miss iA Writer as much as I do? There’s a new Kickstarter to port it.” —Scott Klein, Managing Editor Propublica
“iA writer is coming to Windows. That's worth backing on Kickstarter” –Tom Warren, Senior Editor, The Verge
“Seriously! Any serious writer/student who finds writer's block a problem! Honestly get this! Get the beta! It’s amazing! I’ve already used it this morning to write a full report for work, format it, make it pretty after getting down the bare bones. And fired it away to my boss. It’s just superb!.” —Luxe Oakey
“Thank you for doing this! As a Mac and iOS user who uses iA Writer on both platforms, I'm so happy that you're making a Windows version. I use my Surface Pro in my workflow and it has been frustrating that the clean, minimalist writing app on Windows is not as polished as iA Writer. I'm so excited!” —Dan Matutina
“iA Writer is the absolute best at what it does. It was the hardest app to give up when I switched to a Windows laptop, and I'm thrilled to have it back. ” —Steve Pantol
“Its simplicity betters my focus. Its beauty keeps my attention. I don’t remember not feeling good about writing in iA Writer. This is like having a room dedicated to deep thinking. Every time I would enter that room my mind would do its best. Maybe that is why this is hard to explain: you have to use it for a while before you experience it fully.” —Mostafa Hajizadeh
The iA Team Works Around the Globe
Oliver, Zurich
Chris, Zurich
In Tokyo: Iain and Takeshi
Oliver, Chris and Yumiko (Zurich), Agaric (Lyon), Anton (Helsinki), Ayano and Emiko (Tokyo), and Pedro (Berlin).
The Windows templating logic is compatible with our existing templates.

updates.update_userinfo: When can I download iA Writer for Windows? (for non-backers)
updates.update_content:
If you missed the opportunity to pledge towards iA Writer for Windows while the campaign was running, you're going to have a chance to get your hands on it very soon.
We just pushed an update to our Premium Backers over the weekend and are nearing our gold master. We anticipate to release our 1.0 version publicly next week. Please keep an eye on our Twitter (@iawriter) or our website (ia.net) for details.

updates.update_userinfo: When can I download iA Writer for Windows?
updates.update_content:
Thank you all for the outpouring of support over the whole duration of this campaign. We've received great feedback from so many of you and we're looking forward to get the final features and polish into iA Writer for Windows 1.0.
Now the campaign has closed, Kickstarter grants access to emails of supporters. With these in hand, we've sent notifications to all Premium supporters regarding the latest beta install. We believe we caught everyone, but if you are a Premium Supporter and you have not received these instructions, please email us at ih@ia.net and we'll ensure you are taken care of.

Thanks to your support our Kickstarter fundraising goal has been met and with time to spare. We couldn’t be more excited about the future of iA Writer on Windows. Things are ramping up quickly now and we can’t wait to get iA Writer into everyone’s hands in the very near future.
And while you have been showing your support we haven’t been resting on our laurels. A brand new update to the beta is getting the finishing touches—we plan to send it out to all premium supporters tomorrow.

Thank you all for your support. Today, we broke the 50% barrier. With 16 days left, we are heading for the second half of the way.
In the meantime, we have gotten great feedback through the comments, messages, and by email. The main concern was: "Will I be able to install the app without an admin account?" A painfully obvious question, in retrospect, but this is one reason why we did this Kickstarter: To find out which obvious issues we had overlooked.

updates.update_userinfo: Half way there, we are doubling down
updates.update_content:
We are four days in now, and, with 25 days left, if we continue like this, we will exceed the goal. Thank you for your support and thank you for your feedback. In the meantime, we have been hard at work:
From the first feedback we got from our premium supporters testing the beta, we can proudly say that the app is solid as a rock 
Apart from some minor bugs and visual details, we have used our time so far to push ahead

updates.update_userinfo: We have been hard at work
updates.update_content:
A day has passed, and we have almost reached 1/4 of our goal. Thank you so much for your contributions and for spreading the word. The battle is not won quite yet. Please continue to tell your Windows friends (and in case you know any: bloggers and journalists) about our project so we can reach the goal and get further ahead towards some stretch goals to make the app even better.
ありがとうございます

Press Kit Download Here
Apollo, the world's first portable power pack using graphene composite battery and USB C PD technology. It supports up to charge at 60W, which means the battery with capacity of 6000mAh can be fully charged in 20 minutes or so if using the USB-C 60W Adapter.
 Super Fast Charging 
                Super Fast Charging with the adapter of MacBook Pro 13" 60W
     Specifications
Compatibility
Apollo supports the Power Delivery 3 protocol. You needn’t bring a separate adapter with you, because it is compatible with USB C power adapters of Nintendo Switch, Apple MacBook, Lenovo laptop ,Dell laptop or HP laptop.
If you have only old laptop chargers or MagSafe adapters, you can also use our Anywatt adapter to charge Apollo. 
      PLAY

Besides, Apollo supports 40W USB C PD output, which means it supports the Fast Charging of the latest iPhone 8 or iPhone X, or in an emergency, it supports emergency charge to your Apple Macboook .
      Graphene Composite Battery Inside
Apollo realizes application of graphene composite cell to mobile power pack for the first time in the world (Graphene composite Provided by CellsX) . On the basis of the same capacity and the same charging current, the cell with graphene composite material has much smaller internal resistance and better conductivity. Therefore, the temperature rise is lower during super fast charging, so it is safer, and cell swelling and burning will never happen.

  PLAY

Graphene Battery Charging Performance Test in 8C Rate ( 2500mAh cell Charging in 20A Current) 
PLAY

Surface Temperature of  Graphene Battery Charging Performance Test in 8C Rate
PLAY

Final Temperature of Graphene Battery Charging Performance Test in 8C Rate After Fully Charged. (Noted: 8C Charging Rate which means fully charged in about 7 mins)
Roadmap Of the Graphene Composite Battery Power Pack
Those Graphene Composite Battery cells and the related technology are provided by CellsX ( Also Called NESC in China),  they have spent more than 13 years in the Graphene Battery Cell Technology. We met each other four years ago and we were asked to made the first Graphene Power Bank with their Gen1 Battery ( 60C Charging Rate, 2400mAh) for them, and later we updated it by their Gen2 Battery (30C Charging Rate, 3500mAh) during the next two years.  However, there has two problems in the Gen 1 and Gen 2:
1. 60C or 30C is far more enough when it is applied  in Power Pack ( 5C would be enough) . 
3. Much Smaller Capacity than actual Market requirement. 
Therefore, CellsX had spent more than 3 years to make it smaller in Charging Rate from 60C to 10C  and Higher Capacity from 2400mah to 6000mah in Same size ( Shown as below) ,  and finally, the lastest battery cell was in mass production in Jan 2017 and We used to design the Gen 3rd Power Pack. 
The idea of Apollo Power Bank is confirmed as USB C PD technology is more and more popular, in Gen 1 or Gen 2 Power Pack, it still needed separate adapter to charge it. So we decided to make it compatible with all the USB C PD adapter.  Therefore, we designed the Apollo with USB C PD 3.0 and Called it Gen 4th. 
 The Apollo is all based on the Pre-Mass Production and Feedback of our Gen 3rd (Working in it now). most problems have been solved during Gen 3rd, Apollo will be optimized based on the Gen 3rd, it is likely to have the new features including:
1. CellsX Claimed the Version 4 Battery Cell will improve the capacity in  about 10%-15% in 3~6 months later , if it will be, Apollo will update to about 7000mah when shipment .
2. Improving the Charging effective and lowering heating 
3. Optimized the assembly & Testing process 
4. Try the possibility to  Update the input from 60W to  87W.
One more thing to be noted it that, in Gen 3,  as the bolt voltage of  traditional battery cell is 3V while the Graphene Battery is capable to 2.5V, therefore, the Graphene battery is able to be charged in large current at the beginning, however, one of the chipset, is called 8805, is defined by traditional cell, it will only allowing to charge it in very small current at the beginning, therefore, in 0%-1% it will take about 3-4 min to power up while in 99%-100% will take 4mins. 
Therefore, in Gen 3, the totally charging current is about 27mins (20 min to charge about 98%). We'll try to make it possible to make the charging time in both 0-1% and 99%-100% shorter.
ELECJET TEAM have run anywatt and assisted to run C-Force, if you are Backers from those two projects, you might know that, unlike other projects, we will launch the project before it is 100% not risk in Mass Product and we will provide after-sales services to all the backers. To achieve it, we will release about Gen 3rd into the market where it is manufacturing (China)  for testing the reliability.
Rewards
Our last campaign :  AnyWatt | A Revolutionary Multifunctional Adapter

Apollo Accessories Selectio
Thank you for all your supports. We’re a group engineers who working with USB C for more than 5 years. Therefore, we’re able to develop the innovative product like Anywatt and Apollo. Many backers sent us messages or left comments to us inquiring about the detail accessories information, as the USB C expert , we have been developing many USB C accessories, therefore, we decided to launch it advance in this Kickstarter Project and offering 20%-50% off only for our Dear Backers （shipping fee is included when shipping with Apollo together）, please check it as below:

There are three PD Adapters, all working with widely range of input from 100-240V , Please refer to the picture below.  
For 45W PD Adapter, there are only US Type and EU Type, not interchangeable plug.
However, we have two types of 60W PD adapters, please check the comparison as below. Personally, if you travel often, We would recommend the PD60W001 as it is much portable than the PD60W002 and less weight, it works with Apollo perfectly.
    If you wish to have one of those accessories, please add $xx extra to your current pledge, we will send out the Survey to everyone 3-7 working days after it ends.
       Project Timeline
Other Graphene Composite Battery Applications
The biggest features of the Graphene Composite Battery is Super Fast Charging and long cycling time. They also working the project of  City Delivery e-Vehicle System, which can be fully charged in 15mins～25mins and about 80-100km mileage.
   By http://elecjet.com/

updates.update_userinfo: A Thank You Message For ELECJET Apollo Backers
updates.update_content:
It’s been awhile since our last update. During our previous update, we dispatched 90% of our orders. Today, we are happy to report that we have dispatched 100% of our orders and exchanged and refunded for those we are unable to deliver due to regulation restriction.
It has been a year since we rolled out Project Apollo in December 2017. We are so humble and thankful to everyone’s support, together we have accomplished the very first Graphene battery pack power bank in human history.

updates.update_userinfo: Important Update: Shipment, Payment, Product Support
updates.update_content:
Hello Everyone,  
Shipment:
We can ship battery to below countries and areas:   
Australia

Hello Everyone.
There is a bad news for some of you.
After many attempts, we are unable to send the parcel to India, Philippines and Indonesia, which are the countries we mentioned before trying to ship.

Hello Everyone, sorry for late update!
Our delivery time has been going on for a long time. 
The shipment needs to cover more than 60 countries. Due to some logistics channel limitations, we can't complete the order and will refund the backer, very sorry about that.

Hello Everyone, it's time to update.
1. Questions about USB C to Lightning Cable.
Currently there are 44 backers have selected USB C to Lightning Cable as a addon.
Unfortunately, Apple has blocked third-party data cable when updating IOS.

Hello Everyone!
It's time to update the shipment of Apollo.
We finished the shipment of SG and CA. But we need a couple days to get trk# from forwarder. We have sent mail and message to most EU&AU backers. And these backers are clearly know our trk# mail is later than arrival.

Hello Everyone!
The input and output parameters of Apollo are as following：
The USB C port only supports USB C PD charging protocol. USB A port supports QC3.0 protocol, but does not support SCF of Huawei, Dash of One Plus and VOOC of OPPO.

With the advancement of our delivery work, some backers have received Apollo, and we also received some mails to ask for instructions.  
Apollo project has encountered more difficulties than AnyWatt , and the preparation time is longer than expected. 
This time, in order to speed up the delivery, we did not make a manual, and because the project is a crowdfunding project, we hope that the instructions can be made through feedback from the backer.

Don't bother reading the new update guys. It A) says that there have been last minute design changes to the painting process and even the specifications of the project itself. I mean BIG changes that really affect the usability of this product and dare I say it, bring it nearly on par with other non 'graphene' batteries on the market. B) We have been told that a lot of the backers 'need to change their address' for some reason and I am assuming that little line in there will be used as a liability shield when we all start emailing and asking where our product(s) are. C) they indicated that they had to make last minute asthetic design changes (the color, the entire painting process???) and I have no idea how it could be possible to manufacture 1,461 batteries within the extra ten days that they recently quoted as the expected delay. D) gave us another update with just enough information to keep us hoping that we will finally get our product and prevent us from forgetting the likely reality, that the creators took our money, generosity, and enthusiasm, will keep the majority of the money, and either send us an inferior, cheap product or nothing at all. I just want the creators to respect us enough to write an update with the TRUTH. "We tried our hardest and could not produce a product like the one we promised, but we will send you the best we could do" or "we really have no idea how long this will take, could be this year, next year, or the rest of our lives to produce this." Sorry for the long rant, I just want someone to write a comment for the other backers who are probably like me, waiting, hoping, and trusting that we are being told the truth. This, I believe, is the truth that I have gathered from watching this project progress, communicating with the creators, and the experience I've compiled dealing with creators who have scammed me. I see a pattern and if there is ANYONE considering becoming a backer of this project as of now, DON'T! Other than that have a great day everyone!

campaign.story:
Original Video
 GAMING
Battle Play - tense and exciting! The rules are simple. You must make contact at least once and knock your opponent over while remaining upright. We played many games, but this one had us hooked.
EDUCATION
The software is written in C/C++ which, according to IEEE SPECTRUM, is the computer language most in demand by recruiting companies. The software is free for you to download, modify or completely rewrite. If the campaign is successful, we will be setting up a forum for you to share your code with the community. We recommend the Arduino development platform. Check out the S4A project too! 
HARDWARE
T-BOTS use a combination of accelerometers and gyroscopes to precisely measure the tilt. This information is used to calculate the necessary motor response for the robot to maintain its balance. There are numerous ways of achieving this; both simple and complex.
The T-BOT has an ultrasound distance-measuring module for eyes, providing the user with scope to write algorithms for the robots to interact with their environment or each other.
The bluetooth module allows you to control the robot using your smart phone or PC. See Joystick Bluetooth Commander.
Technical Specifications
Acrylic Chassis 
Open Source Arduino based Microcontroller 
MPU 6050 MEMS Module Tri-Axis Gyroscope, Tri-Axis Accelerometer 
HC-SR04 Ultrasound Module 
TB6612FNG Motor Driver Board 
HC-05 Bluetooth Module 
CREATE
T-BOTS have been designed to inspire creativity. From designing your own T-BOT skins, inventing your own games, learning to program using the Arduino development platform or Scratch (S4A), understanding the physics of balance and dynamic stabilization, all the way up to advanced control theory. Or you can just assemble the robot, download the software and play! T-BOTS are an excellent example of a STEAM product that is genuinely fun!
      Fluffy
                        A T-BOT was used to help film the campaign video! The model for the dolly adaptor can be made freely available for 3D printing.
PLAY

The design is complete, we have working prototypes, the quotes and lead times are in! We are ready to go on completion of a successful campaign. 
Why £100k. The short answer is, economy of scale. The long answer...
I’m a scientist and I have three children. I wanted to inspire them with a project that would teach them about science, mathematics, electronics, programming, product design and even explore concepts like artificial intelligence. So I designed a robot called Robie (see below). 
When their friends saw Robie, they wanted to know if they could buy one. Until that point, I hadn’t even considered selling robots. Robie was much too complicated to launch as a first product with no infrastructure in place. So I set out to design an endearing robot that would be affordable for as many people as possible, and so the T-BOTS were born! When setting the target I considered two things. First, I did some market research to gauge people’s response to the T-BOTS. People were both intrigued and charmed by these little chaps, so I new we had a saleable product. Second, I explored options to make them affordable while maintaining the highest quality. This is where the economy of scale comes in. For example, the chassis will be laser cut and the wheels will be injection moulded. When seeking quotes I discovered the obvious - the cost drops significantly if you order in bulk. The cost per unit for a thousand was significantly less expensive than 500 and 2000 was significantly less expensive than 1000. But of course, this must be balanced against the likelihood of finding a higher number of backers. I looked at other products that had been launched on Kickstarter and thought that selling 2000 T-BOTS seemed achievable.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Inevitably, manufacturing a new product carries with it risks of delays in production due to the supply chain. We will be open and honest in our communication in the event that any delays arise.

KLiK ROBOTICS and Kickstarter both stress that this platform is not a traditional store, and hope that you understand that you are joining a journey. We're confident that it will be one you enjoy. We are very excited to launch T-BOTS and are grateful for your part in it.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
If you've been searching for the ultimate Spinner with the future written all over it then you'll LOVE this...
Spinneroo is a hand spinner, designed to help focus attention, increase creativity and keep fidgeting fingers busy.
Spinneroo is Spinner 2.0
"The programmable LEDs keeps creativity flowing and the Bluetooth speaker will keep you entertained."
Get one for yourself and another for that special someone that you can send with a special LED message or a voice gram. The possibilities are endless!
 Reinventing Ergonomics - An improved, sleeker profile allows for a more comfortable spinning experience. Kick, Pull or Flick with comfort and ease. Three weighted outer arms add stability to the frame, which is centred by US-made R188 hybrid ceramic bearing for smooth and long spin time, and the threaded caps for easy inspection and cleaning.
Why US Made Bearing - This is rare among spinners and part of the reason ours cost a bit more then some others. The cost of our bearing retails for about $20, we'll buy it in bulk at a lower price and we think it makes a huge difference and we believe it's well worth it!
Exquisite Materials – Made from aerospace grade aluminium and anodized to create a durable, corrosion-resistant surface. The anodizing process adds a semi-glossy texture that is available in exquisite silver, black or blue finish.
Balance, Strength & Durability – Spinneroo’s frame is well balanced, robust and durable, manufactured in Australia and machined to a professional finish.
Input text, decide colour, features, message and graphics
Spinneroo App available for iOS and Android
Creative Juices Extractor – Spinneroo can display a message or make a statement with text or graphics in lights from an intuitive, easy to use companion mobile App that’s available for both iOS & Android. Spinneroo can also display statistics such as battery level, speed or RPM of your spinner so you never need to wonder how fast you were spinning or how many revolutions you have been accruing and if that is not enough Spinneroo can play your favourite tunes from the built-in speaker while you fidget or relax.
Features
Spinneroo: For Children, Teens & Adults alike!
Not only does it help relieve your stress and Anxiety, it will also help you focus!
Enhances Creativity
Increases Productivity
Expands attention span
Motivates brain functions
Helps with focus 
Final Design and Ready to Produce – We have the final product prototype and design and we are ready for production. We anticipate a manufacturing period of 8 weeks from the end of the campaign to start shipping Spinneroo to you 8 weeks after the end of this campaign and no later than November 10th, 2017 and well in time for the holidays!  We Guarantee it.

campaign.story:
Retroball is a build-it-yourself kit which follows in the footsteps of the classic 'PONG' style video games. Retroball allows you to play with two, three or four players and up to five balls on the screen at the same time.
With a step-by-step building video and less than a dozen components to solder in - Retroball can be put together by even a newcomer to electronics. Retroball can be powered by any standard USB port, USB charger or USB charge bank.
*Note - The screen filter, USB cable and rubber mounting feet have been omitted from the photo but are included in every Retroball kit.
Each game mode can be played with two, three or four players:
One Ball Easy - Slower game play which is great for beginners. 
One Ball Hard - Fast paced action to test your reflexes. 
Five Balls - Can you handle the mayhem?
The ball may be spun off the bat in different directions, at different angles and speeds depending on how you hit the ball. It makes for some great gameplay!
If you miss a ball, you lose a point. If you lose all of your points, your paddle is replaced with a wall. The last player standing - wins!
Soldering Iron and Solder 
Phillips ScrewDriver 
Pliers
240mm x 240mm Matte Black Circuit Board
Tinted Screen Filter
32 x 32 Pixel RGB LED Matrix Display (160mm x 160mm)
8 Potentiometers (Four of which are spares) 
4 Potentiometer Knobs 
USB Connector 
LED Matrix Ribbon Cable + Connector 
LED Matrix Power Cable + Connector 
Two Push Buttons 
PIC 18F46K22 Microcontroller (Pre-programmed with Retroball)
Filter Capacitor 
USB Cable 
40 Pin 0.1" (2.54mm) Male Headers (For those who wish to experiment with their Arduino Uno)
For those who want to run their own experiments, Retroball comes with a built in slot for you to plug in your own Arduino Uno or compatible microcontroller. Just download the Adafruit Library and get coding! (Note: only two of the four potentiometers are available for your Arduino due to limited pins on the Arduino). Some example will be provided to get you started.
An Arduino is not required to make Retroball work however.
All source files will be made available once the campaign is completed including:
PCB Design Files 
PIC Microcontroller Source Code 
Bill of Materials 
Schematic Diagram
Arduino Sample Sketches
A hidden menu gives you access to these extra features:
Screen Pixel Test 
Potentiometer Controller Test 
Screensaver 1 
Screensaver 2 
LED Sketch (Like etch-a-sketch) 
The Great Race 
Dice
For those who have had anything to do with these RGB matrix displays, (perhaps you've bought one from Adafruit or Sparkfun) - you may have seen that they have an inherent problem with producing some very dim green pixel ghosting.
I take pride in delivering a quality product and can assure you that I have worked on the Retroball code to virtually cancel out any green pixel ghosting. This means you cannot see green pixel ghosting when playing in a lit room and is barely noticeable when playing in a dark room. Either way, the game plays perfectly fine.
PCB dimensions 24cm x 24cm (9.5" x 9.5")
LED Matrix Dimensions 160mm x 160mm
Completed kit weight approximately 650grams (1.43lb)
Packaged weight approximately 1.1kg (2.43lb)
Retroball is powered by an 8-bit PIC 18F46K22 Microcontroller running at 64Mhz with 64KB of program memory and 3.8K of SRAM. 
The LED matrix contains 1024 RGB LED's which provides a 32 x 32 pixel playing area. 
Backers are also able to use their own Arduino Uno (or compatible) microcontroller by soldering in the 0.1" male headers (which are provided with every kit). You can then download the Adafruit library to code your own experiments. I will provide details and some sample code to get you guys started.
Depending on your country - shipping will be through DHL, TNT, EMS or Singapore Post. All items will be sent out from my manufacturer in China which is a much more cost effective method rather than having all parts sent to me in Australia to then send out.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have run numerous successful Kickstarter campaigns over the past few years and have been able to fulfil the backer rewards with quite a minimum of fuss. Retroball is very similar to my previous campaigns and since I will be using essentially the same suppliers and manufacturers, I am very confident that this campaign will run smoothly.

However challenges do arise such as delays with components and / or PCB manufacture etc... However since I have been working on projects like this since 2007 and have dealt extensively with component and pcb manufacturing companies, along with running numerous successful Kickstarter campaigns, I am confident that if any challenges do arise, I will certainly be able to overcome them to again make this a successful campaign.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: How are your Retroball kits going?
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
I thought i'd post an update to see how your Retroball kits are going - mainly to see if anyone is having any issues with them.
Through the Kickstarter campaign and selling some left over units on Tindie i've had a small handful of people who have had issues with their kits however we have been able to fix this up by troubleshooting via email. For example a couple of people had inserted the PIC microcontroller around the wrong way, other people had not put enough solder on their connections and one person had a faulty potentiometer.

updates.update_userinfo: How to get your Arduino up and running on Retroball.
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone, I hope you all had a great Christmas. This update is many weeks over due and I certainly apologise for that. I have made a short video showing you how to get your Arduino up and running on the Retroball PCB using Arduino Create.
I have provided some basic examples to get you started and since I have used the Adafruit RGB matrix libraries - you can get some more information about how to use the library from their website:

updates.update_userinfo: Update on the poor quality of the PCB's
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
We have just arrived back from overseas where we attended my brothers wedding - it was certainly a costly venture taking myself, my wife and our four kids! So I apologise for the lack of updates.
This particular update is to let you know that I have been in discussion with the PCB manufacturer to discuss the poor quality of PCB's with them I.E. with respect to the scratches that a lot of people have on their boards. Long story short - they have given me a $500USD credit to get PCB's manufactured to compensate.

Hi everyone, I wanted to have another little video completed by now to show you how to connect up your Arduino and / or Teensy, however I haven't done this yet. I do have files uploaded to my website which you can download and include:
Sourcecode for the PIC microcontroller (this is the retroball game sourcecode and I apologise that it actually isn't commented throughout the code.)

Hi guys Defragster has found a mistake in the PCB 3.3v/5v connection. Unfortunately it was my fault for not double checking the routing after running the auto router. This means you can use a teensy 3.2 or 3.5 but not 3.6.
More details will come in a future update.

updates.update_userinfo: Tracking details are on their way!
updates.update_content:
Hi all,
Fellow backer Justin has done a fantastic job of creating an app which imports a CSV file with tracking details and email addresses and sends them all out. So you should be receiving your tracking details within just a few minutes of this update hitting your inbox.
I have had word from one backer in Hong Kong who has received their kit already. Remember - the unboxing and build instructions are attached to update #6:
Your rewards are on their way! I've just been informed that the packages were all picked up and processed today. Here's some photo's of the pickup:

All I can say is - that was a huge mission!
After days of skyping back and forth with the shipping agency and my manufacturer, we have finally worked out shipping methods for every single backer. This may not seem like it should be such a hard task but It has been one confusing ride - thats for sure.
As mentioned nearly two weeks ago, I picked up a few things with the shipping arrangements that I was not happy about and since then I have found more issues which have now been corrected. For example, the shipping agency has codes for hundreds of different shipping methods but they weren't able to provide me with a cross reference of what shipping method each code was.

Hi everyone, this update isn't really giving any interesting information but serves to let you know that I am still here - but I am here simply waiting...
As the previous update explained, there were some things picked up with the shipping labels that I wasn't happy with - and didn't want to risk sending all the packages out due to these issues. China is nearing the end of their eight day holiday and it will be business as usual come Monday 8th October. once they are back, they will go through my shipping spreadsheet again to ensure the shipping methods are correct and the shipping weights are correct also. The labels will be issued and applied to the boxes, the boxes will then be picked up and shipped out.

Hi everyone, I hate to bring bad news but will always be transparent with any issues.
It looks like there will be a delay in shipping out all the order to you all - here's the story:
My manufacturing agent in China has been working hard to get all kits ready for shipping, every single kit is boxed, all addresses have been uploaded to the shipping agents system and every single shipping label has been printed and attached to each box. About an hour ago my manufacturing agent sent me some photo's of some boxes with the shipping labels on and told me that the shipping agent is ready to pick them all up tomorrow to take to the shipping warehouse to then get sent out.

Just FYI....SFC tracking is very odd. If you click on the tracking link you'll find another tracking number on that page. That's your specific tracking number used with the specific carrier they choose for you. Cut and paste that number into the tracking window above then click the orange Track button. You'll get more specific tracking details. For me the link shows my package is in HK but the more specific tracking shows it's in the US already. In fact, in a city right next to me and now when I click on the original link it shows everything right away. But that'll default back to just HK tomorrow. Yeah, very odd way to handle tracking. It used to be worse but they are getting better.

Excellent response to backer community, not just in terms of answering questions but input goes into design finalisation. Above all, learns lessons along the way and project manages like a dream. While many KS projects fall short - I’m looking forward (with absolute certainty) to a quality project delivered - despite the rare bumps in the road.

I've seen other disasters in Kickstarter campaigns in this regard with dozens of "lost" rewards that sour participants and open floodgates of bad sentiment along with horrific postings by some backers. Super Big THANK YOU!

BTW - quick note - The advance RetroBall unit I got was of really good quality - a nice heavy and solid feeling base unit that was ready to run with the PIC processor (okay mine was pre-assembled). The out of the box assembly won't change with the addition the change to the PCB to support Teensy. It already had the UNO pinout on the board - and now like the Teensy - it can be ignored and run as documented in the main Campaign as shown.
https://youtu.be/AOV9c8WkWsw
With Retroball's low resolution, I don't know if having less area to tend would be any easier since you'd have (with all the paddles now closer to each other) less time to react to the incoming ball.

Brad's got the PCB updates to solder a Teensy on underway and looking good. As far as I can tell it is working well. Should be nice with added pin headers ( PIC too ) and RTC clock battery for other projects - CLOCK or IOT display. Full on white display can eat 2 amps - but with wall power and an ESP8266 onboard it could be about anything - maybe a motion sensor to de-activate it.

@Justin - it was almost fun - too many wires to run though :) Brad putting native Teensy footprint on the PCB will save a lot of trouble and offer some nice uses. Updated PCB layout underway. Learned a few things - pots at 5V will need to run at 3V3 for Teensy for safe and full range on all, and Teensy LC didn't work with the wiring same that did for 3.1/3.2/3.5/3.6.
Thanks for your time Defragster!

I forwarded the Teensy pinout I'm using to Brad and that will easily fit on the board - I'll leave any other details for Brad in an update. But those who like 32 bit Teensy and Arduino it looks like this will be open to using that rather than the PIC.
http://www.8-bitcentral.com/images/reviews/atari2600/warlords2600Screen.jpg
@Creator: I'll prefer a reliable good product that is on time rather than one that ships before it is ready.
@Creator. Seeing as you are over your finding amount and have a lot of enthusiastic backers , is there a possibility of bringing the delivery schedule forward !!

https://youtu.be/8k9e-kplK5g

Thanks!
I'm seeing a lot of options online, so I guess if you give the examples in swordfish basic I can always try to work it out myself in another language :)
Looking at the specs of the PIC it should be possible to program in whatever language you want (within reason) so if you could add any examples in C for example that would be exemplary

@Bradley yes, it sounds fun to make for example a TRON game or maybe even an extremely minimalistic bomberman clone. I don't mind learning a new language, but 100 USD is a bit steep - is there no other way to use the PIC microcontroller?
Just the specifics of how to program this particular thing, so how to get code from my computer to the chip, how to read the potentiometers and how to write to the screen
Is there a (or can you make a) tutorial on how to program the 18F46K22 directly? I have an arduino, but the whole reason I want this is the potential for 4 person game play...

Nothing to add or ask just excited to see this work out so I pledged. Interesting to learn something about the PIC ( BASIC .vs. Arduino) as I have not looked before - but settled on Teensy and find them to be cost effective and powerful. Interested to see if they can be fitted to the RetroBall as a PIC/UNO replacement. I've found code source mods to Adafruit Lib that suggest it worked for T_3.2 and T_3.5.
Thanks :)
looking at game point of view. What is the size of the screen?
Encoders have advantage of less wear (optical encoders) and unlimited 360 degree spinning. Is it software complexity or encoder cost?
Thanks.

@Brad thanks for he update - totally transparent - postage really can't be helped with the volumes you're dealing with, as well as the size and relative weight of the components. @NialP nice to see you on board - looks like I might be needing to buy myself a Teensy.

The PCB is huge compared to the stuff that has to be on it due to the LED panel's size, so I think it's feasible to have multiple breakout headers on it. The only problem is voltage shifting, since that needs additional components that add to the BOM costs (even though it's a small amount).
Ciao, Mathias

Also Teensy's are easily programmed in the Arduino IDE and have standard Arduino I/O pins. You could even drop that extra added Arduino socket and switch to a Teensy footprint (smaller, faster & more pins inc all the Arduino "add on" features in place already.
Ciao, Mathias
The Teensy 3.6 is pretty nice and has plenty of performance. Just keep in mind that it has 3.3V levels on the GPIOs, while these panels need 5V for their inputs.
Awesome, thanks!
Does every reward tier now have a filtered screen? I see there's no option anymore yet your campaign shows all filtered images.
Back in again and it looks like you almost got your goal. Congrats!

I would have preferred the headers to be compatible with a Teensy or something like that, so I could have access to all of the potentiometers… The Teensy is also much more powerful than the Uno, although there are a lot of powerful boards that can plug into that shield connector anyways (like the Nucleo boards or the UDOO Neo).

Hi Brad, I'm keen to make use of RetroBall as a pixel art display - in addition to all the cool stuff it does already. There have been exclusively pixel art frames that have just been too rich for my blood but I'm guessing that by slotting in the Arduino Uno is that something I can expect to be able to do with RetroBall? As a noob would it be a matter of programming the onboard controller through the Uno with a few libraries downloaded, assigning it in the hidden menu, remove the Uno and then pixel-art-a-go-go? With the Uno mounted will there need to be a second source of power - or do the header connections keep that down to one? I managed to get quite tricksy with the Digirule by learning to use the Pickit etc. and looking forward to a new learning opportunity by getting the Uno out of the drawer to do something a bit more challenging than traffic lights!

campaign.story:
About this project
NIWA —  Nixie tube round watch.
NIWA is a nixie tube wristwatch which displays time using vintage Nixie tube and modern technologies. Case is made of solid machined aluminium (polished or painted).  The tubes produces no noise or heat, uses very little energy and is the most beautiful way of displaying time. 
Our team was working on this project for almost 2 years before the final prototype was ready and fully tested. It uses a gyro sensor to display time and save power. So it will light up only when you need to display time. After tests we chosen the most powerful and compact phone battery, IN-16 Nixie tubes were the most stable working tubes. We understand that this technologies are complicated and this tubes are really hard to find. We decided to provide a lifetime warranty for watch and all it's components. And you can enjoy the Nixie tubes really warm and unusual shine and it's design will help you stand out of the crowd.
NIWA Nixie tube watches has two very distinctive features that are bound to impress who love innovative and eye-catching watches. First, the NIWA watch’s unusual and eye-catching look sets it apart from the thousands of other watches available in the market currently. Designed using high quality and reliable materials the NIWA watch takes the steampunk watch look to a whole new level. Secondly, the nixie tubes or old cathode display brings back the much-loved retro technology from the 70’s and 80’s.
AVAILABLE IN 2 COLOURS 
Key Specs
 Measures 55mm diameter round watch
 Available in grey and black colours anodized cases machined from aircraft aluminium
 24mm watch straps
 Docking station for charging (USB powered)
 2 x IN-16 Nixie tubes
 2 x IV-15 tubes
 Lifetime warranty for Nixie tubes


You will receive:
1 NIWA Nixie watch
Dock station with stand
Extra 2 IN 16  tubes
Magnet for reed switches to set up time
Power USB cable
Wood box wrapped in special Kickstarter paper
 Avaliable straps
You can choose one of the following straps together with your NIWA Nixie watch. Silicone, metal and leather.
NIWA Nixie watch shows time only when you want to. Usually you need to charge your watch each 4-6 days depending on how often you use it. Charging takes 3 hours.
PLAY

PLAY

NIWA Nixie watch has 2 reed switches and are not visible. You need a magnet to set up time and format. 
PLAY

 REWARDS
 Right now you can choose a NIWA Nixie watch with Sapphire glass which is $35 more then with original glass. If the Stretch goal #2 will be reached we will do a $10 refund for everybody who choosed NIWA Nixie watch with sapphire glass.
 TIMELINE
 OUR TEAM 
 Dzianis Obukhau 
project creator
 Alexander Avramenko  
developer and designer of electronic devices
 Vladimir Bludov 
Designer

updates.update_content:
Hello NIWA watches fans. Just want to pay your attention for 1 minute
My partner started a new campaign here on Kickstarter. He likes to do custom leather accessories and right now is specialaize in custom belts. If you interested- please take a look
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/beltdesign1/your-belt-design?ref=discovery&term=your%20belt

We are about 1 month delay in delivery of last 35 watches. All this watches were ready but during pre delivery tests 8 of 35 watches showed that there is problems with battiry- it didn't hold the charge for 5 days- in this way we had to remove batteries from all watches and order new battiries- right now we received new tested battiries installed them in NIWA watches and start sending them next week.
Really sorry for this delay but we have to be sure that quality of our watches is on a level and you can enjoy it for a long time

As for May 1 we need to send rewards to 110 backers. 30 watches are ready for delivery and will be sent during this week. We have some delays in delivery grey batteries for grey NIWA watches- 5 watches are ready and about 20 watches will be ready end of May. According to production we suppose to send watches to all our backers during May-early June.
Please note that straps #9,11,14,15,16,17,18 are not available or doesn't fit in sizes to NIWA watches- we are sending similar ones which fit watches and similar in style.

As for now we finished production NIWA watches with engraved number up to 100 and sending them right now. Also we finishing sending watches without enfraved back lids. Right now NIWA watches with engraved numbers 100-200 are in work. We will contact all backers with this numbers during this week.
As our dock stations sometimes had probems with magnets we made a new one which doesn't has this problems.

As we have all engraved back lids, we post an update of backers number which is ready for delivery and which is in production ( it will take about 2 weeks).
Also 18 black NIWA watches and 5 grey ones are ready for delivery. We will contact backers who ordered NIWA watch without engraving this week about delivery.

We are finishing delivery of NIWA watches without engraving. Only last week we received engraved back lids with backers number. Previous 2 shipments with engraved back lids were bad quality. Right now first watches with engraved back lids are assemblng and testing. Next week we start delivery this watches.
All Nixie clocks are ready and also ready for delivery.

Really sorry for our disappearing. I had an urgent surgery and spent 3 weeks in hospital. Didn't have an access to my computer and internet. And the problem was that all access to accounts was only on 1 computer ( which is my fault).
This is what happened during 3 weeks
1. We fixed 1 bug in watch program. Right now during charging if there is a voltage surges NIWA watch keeps time and doesn't go to 0 (this may happens in previous program version). Same thing was happening when watch was hit or fall down. Right now it keeps time in every situation,

We didn't add a paper manual to NIWA watches. It's really easier to watch this videos and then to do a set up.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xiF-Wvm_dyQ&t=58s
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m4C_9Y5iIRc

Hi NIWA watch community.
As for today, November 1, we sent about 95 watches which is about 1/3 of all orders. Right now we are sending NIWA watches without back lid engraving. We expect delays in delivery of engraved back lids. Delivery right now is scheduled for mid November.
We are trying to speed up production but we see that every time we are trying to do it faster we get issues. We ask all our backers to wait little more to receive a NIWA watch and be satisfied . If you have any questions- please ask it or send message. We are trying to answer all of them.

A lot of our backers asks when they receive NIWA watches and why some low numbers backers did receive there watches yet.
So far we sent 35 grey NIWA watches and 1 black. Right now we started sending black watches. About 25 watches are ready for delivery and 35 will be ready next week. During October we should send 90 black NIWA watches, 15 Grey ones and 7 clocks. This will include pledges for NIWA watch and clock and Combo pledges.

@Yauheni & Dzianis - Always glad to help. You guys must be pretty busy arranging balance shipments and are unable to check the comments here regularly.

@Michael Skeggs (my mobile auto corrected your name the first time.. Sorry) - to continue showing the seconds for more than one or two seconds in succession, you need to tilt the watch slowly to an angle less than 45 degrees from horizontal and not beyond 45 degrees as I have stated earlier.

@Michael Skaggs - Unfortunately, there is no option to toggle the seconds on or off. You will need to experiment a little. I find that if you tilt the watch swiftly to a 45-degree angle, the Niwa will only display the hour and minutes. If you tilt the watch slowly to a 45-degree angle, it will show the hour, minutes and will also display the seconds once or twice in succession. If you tilt it slowly to an angle just beyond 45 degrees, it will show the hour, minutes and seconds but the seconds will continue to show until you change the angle of the tilt. Hope that helps. Have fun playing with it.

@Beau Smith - I have backed several watches. The ZeTime will probably be my main watch. I feel that Niwa may be too fragile (because of its large face) for everyday use. Also, the Niwa is more unique and precious to me.

I remember writing this display code about 15 years ago, for the original two-digit Nixie watch, of which this produce is appearing to be a copy. The display timing is interesting. The seconds change when the RTC says it's time to change, but the display of hours and minutes is triggered by the wrist movement, so it's not synchronized to the RTC seconds changing. This means that the delay from displaying minutes to displaying seconds must be variable to accommodate this asynchronism. Either that, or the main display has to be delayed to synchronize it to the seconds counter. Can't have your cake and eat it too.
Sapphire glass for additional $25: UNLOCKED

The only thing we need to fix is to make sure that the duration (when the tubes are on) to display the hours, the minutes and the seconds is long enough to tell time AND the duration (when the tubes are off) between displaying the hours, the minutes and the seconds is the same (e.g. if the tubes are off for 1 second between flashing hours and minutes, they should also be off for 1 second between flashing minutes and seconds).
Why, because if not, it makes it super hard to show someone the watch functionality if it shuts off when you move your wrist to show them.

Let me clarify my statement then. Any departure from the original design as perceived by the creators should be put to a vote just to be sure that such departure will be adopted by majority vote. After all, we decided to back the creators' original design from the outset subject to minor tweaks.

I see that the programming of the time display in your watch is being questioned, rightly so. I did some tricks in my Cathode Corner Nixie watch design to allow me to blank the display cleanly. The high voltage is dropped to about 90V when the accelerometer is powered up, by means of an extra resistor in the supply feedback circuit. This lets me use that control bit to blank the display quickly while keeping the HV converter running. There are other subtleties in the hardware and in the software. I also provide both a programming connector and tube sockets, to facilitate repairs and upgrades. This is why I've been able to sell over a thousand of these watches in the last ten years. Oh, and the Woz.
