updates.update_userinfo: Release of Music Mesh with DJ Control!
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers,
We're super excited to finally get you Music Mesh with DJ Control!
Mesh/DJ is one of the coolest new features of our technology, and enables your Gemio band to sync effects with your friends' bands and control light effects across them using the app in Music Mode and controlling the color wheel.  See demo.

updates.update_userinfo: April 4 is the last day for exclusive early-birds
updates.update_content:
Hi Gemio Friends, 
Thank you all so much for all the enthusiasm, support and patience during this Kickstarter campaign.  We could not have brought Gemio to life without each and every one of you!  
Please take a minute to check out a video from our Founder, Michael Bettua, talking about a very exciting social feature that will be released soon - 'Music Mesh'.  More features are on the way so please stay tuned in with us via social @gogemio! If you need anything else at all drop us a line - Friends@gogemio.com.

Hi Gemio Backers!!
We wanted to share some insider tips with you in response to the most popular questions we are getting from Backers.
There are 2 different ways to change Light Effects:
1. Download the Gemio App - Change your Light Effects or choose a solid color depending on your mood and the vibe around you.

Hi Gemio Friends, 
If you missed it, please also check out the post from earlier this week by our CEO and Founder, Michael Bettua, giving you some sneak peeks into what is coming next at Gemio. 
Since the Bands have been shipped out, one of the most popular questions we are receiving is how to pair your phone with your Band. True, you can enjoy all the light effects by pressing the button on your Band. But if you want to control the Band, or create solid colors, you need to pair with the Gemio App (avail for iOS and Android). Check out the below tutorial video on how exactly to get that done. There is also an Android Version of this video on our YouTube channel!
PLAY

Hi Gemio Backers,
This is our final week of shipping so very soon all Backer orders will be en route. Please continue to share pictures, videos and feedback. Our team loves to hear what you think!
Also, we have gotten lots of questions for how to best use your Gemio Band/App and are starting a weekly series of posts called “Gemio Spotlight”. Each week, we will share a video from our YouTube Channel focused on a different aspect of the Band and App along with some insider tips.

Hello Backers!
Shipping continues! We have been working on streamlining our processes, and have brought on more staff to further speed things up. Right now it looks like all orders will be shipped by September 12th!
Thanks to all of you who have shared pictures and other feedback about your bands. Customer input is very helpful as we continue to refine the Gemio Band. Please keep it up!

Hi Gemio Backers,
We wanted to update you and let you know the balance of our Backer orders have been received into our warehouse facility and we will continue filling orders as quickly as we can. Once your order has been shipped, you will receive a shipping notification from our customer service team so please be on the lookout.

@gemio I realized I may not have elaborated on the 180 degree idea as much. Quite simple: No vibration when facing/travelling the correct direction and then ramp up linearly until the user is at 180 degrees from the correct direction. This means that if you veer off course, you'll feel vibration, and if you continue turning the wrong way the vibration will increase letting you know that that is the wrong direction and you should go the other way. The only tricky part here is figuring out the margins of error. For example, how big should the window be that is considered the 'correct' direction? Also, sampling the direction from the phone's compass would probably need to be averaged over some time interval because the phone bouncing around in someone's pocket while their walking is likely to provide a somewhat noisy signal. Testing would be required to figure out what variables work, but that's all software so it's very possible..

As far as hardware, you're stuck with it being a phone dependent feature. But on the brightside, these are already integrated with the phones and phones have all the required hardware (compass and gps). Additionally, from what I can tell based on the info in the campaign, phones are already required for advanced functionality such as changing lighting modes and sending messages.. it doesn't seem like too much a drawback to have the 2nd device dependency. It would be one more advanced feature to add to the repertoire that requires your phone to not be dead... and it seems like useful one! So I hope you guys will continue to give it consideration as I think it would be an excellent feature that you can implement with the existing hardware and a huge selling point.

  Materials
The leather used is only the finest 100% Natural leather carefully chosen its beautiful character and supple yet strong finish, while maintaining the highest quality product.
All natural fibres, another key aspect that makes an Anhänger an Anhänger, are the perfect combination of beauty and strength, without compromising the quality and durability of the tag itself by hand waxing the twine.
Making The Anhänger's
 Anhänger is unique
Each Anhänger piece is a work of natural beauty. The combination of raw materials and hand construction creates a unique piece of beauty only nature could conceive. We live in a day where you can control almost your whole life from a smart device in your hand, which is nothing short of amazing, however that sense of natural beauty could never be replaced or recreated by any machine.
Anhänger Classic Ready To Go
 Colours
Our plan is to launch Anhänger with three original colours; Burgundy, Tan and Black. Due to the nature of the leather we like to work with, each colour run will be limited and therefore exclusive. We will always offer a version of black, tan and burgundy. We will offer runs of special colours for a limited number of pieces, these colours will be influenced by seasons and request popularity .
Colour Option Pro
 Custom Stamping
A big part of Anhängers’ creation was to offer something unique, special and individual. The whole point of a luggage tag is to identify one's traveling belongings. The best way to do that is by customising your luggage to stand out from the crowd. We will offer a range of personalisation options depending on the different Anhänger models, everything from large monogrammed letters or short messages on the Pro or Classic, to embossed contact detials on the Lite.
Anhänger Stamping Sample
 Stretch Goals 
(Colours in table are not an actual representation of leather colours)
Stretch Goals
 Anhänger Models
Anhänger Pro
Refined, extravagant, the top of the line Anhänger, showing the world you mean business. The Anhänger Pro is Large enough to be clearly visible with its Traditional yet modern look. With its extra Privacy Flap over the front it ads durability and uniformity to the tag. Perfect size to add your business card if preferred. Comes in 3 colours for the moment; Black, Burgundy, Tan
Anhänger Pro Ready To Go
Anhänger Classic
Sophisticated, powerful, the most popular Anhänger model for all of your luggage needs. The Anhänger Classic is Large enough to be clearly visible with its Traditional yet modern look. Open front to easily view your information when recquired. Perfect size to add your business card if preferred. Comes in 3 colours for the moment; Black, Burgundy, Tan
Anhänger Pro/Classic
Anhänger Lite
Simple, Elegant, Perfect for your smaller luggage or every day bag. The Anhänger Lite Delivers the same High quality Leather that the Pro and Classic models have, as well as the same hand etched, personalised details. The strap on the Anhänger Lite is a smaller strap still with incredible strength capabilities. Comes in 3 colours for the moment; Black, Burgundy, Tan.
Anhänger Lite
 Interchangeable straps
The Anhänger Pro and the Anhänger classic, both have interchangeable straps to suit everyone's needs. There are three lengths available, 
Small:      18cm
Original:   21cm
Large:      26cm
each chosen as they represent the lengths most commonly used.
Strap Lengths
There are also three colours avaliable, though with many more to come very soon! Black, Beige, Burgundy
Current Colour Options
You can swap out your straps for longer or shorter versions, or personalise your anhänger, and get another colour!
Individual Style
Production of the anhanger
All Anhänger are crafted by hand in our workshop in Sydney Australia, where we have been working tierlessley for the preparation and release of this Kickstarter.
What we Need from you is your help to be able to purchase the leather and other materials for the anhänger, as well as train more staff to be able to organise the continuous production of the ahnänger range.
Cutting Straps
 The Design Process
The design of the Anhänger came around about 9 months ago, where it was a meer drawing on a boarding pass on a long taxi ride to the hotel, and since then it has been worked on and tweaked continuously. The main design of the anhänger has been the same throughout the whole process, to create something that stands out and makes its mark, though there have been many minor changes along the way. but right now, we feel that we have perfected the design and that it is ready to tag the world.
Hand Drawn Anhänger Classic
 Who we are
Nicolas came up with the idea for the kickstarter after his trip, and so he drew up the designs on a boarding pass on the way to the hotel, and once he arrived back home later that week, he started making a luggage tag out of paper, the first prototype. After this he continued playing with the design and finally made one out of leather, which became a birthday gift for Marcus who also saw the lack of options in the market, therfore before long they were both working on the project, where they decided to make a kickstarter to help them get everything started.
Nicolas (left) Marcus (right)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our first kickstarter project, so there will of course be many unexpected challenges along the way, such as the possibility of not being able to keep up with production rates as it is a custom and hand made product, as well as possible shipping delays. Though the risks that do arise will be dealt with as quickly as possible, and our backers will always be kept informed to whats going on.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Weighitz are smart, portable, modular and high precision. They can be used individually or combined to weigh just about anything.
Use Weighitz as a single scale or as a set. Alone, they are ideal for home kitchen use. When combined, a set of Weighitz can weigh heavier or more oddly shaped objects.
A set of Weighitz can replace all your home weighing scales. Weighitz have no platform, so you’re no longer constrained by size or shape. Calibrate any container to weigh whatever you like. Need to weigh your Labrador? Turn their dog bed into a smart scale. 
Weighitz are designed to be easy to use. Just squeeze on, place them under whatever you need to weigh, open the app and begin weighing.
Weighitz output to the Weighitz smartphone app. The app makes weighing smart and simple.
  When using more than one Weighitz, the app will combine the readings from all the scales into a single reading.
We have been amazed at the number of suggestions for Weighitz applications. We encourage backers to tell us how Weighitz might solve one of their weighing problems. Here are the top apps we have created so far: All of the below are part of the main Weighitz app.
App Examples
  Sensitive enough to weigh herbs and spices. They also have a wide range, so you can weigh heavy things like flour and rice. Planning a party for twenty guests? Combine Weighitz to weigh just about anything. Weighitz can do a lot of other cool things, like convert metric to imperial units. Even convert non-standard units like cups to grams.
Kitchen Scale
  The Weigh-Anything app allows the user free range over Weighitz. Users can see the combined reading. The readings from each Weighitz or even the raw uncalibrated units. The Weigh anything app is ideal for those with unique weighing needs, below are a few of our favorite uses.
Pet, baby & infant Scale - Turn the bed into a scale
Weigh pets and babies with ease
Sample Scale (compare sample weights in real time)
Compare Samples
 Weigh Packages (0-270lb)
Weigh Packages
  The app connects to a large database that contains the nutritional content of a wide range of foods. This data displays when weighing and records the nutrients in each meal.
Portion Control
 Portion control is vital for those on strict diets, like athletes and diabetics. 
The portion control app will integrate with a larger health application - including - calorie and diet recommendations.
This will also be integrated into the automatic baking and smoothie making apps - with healthy recipe alternative and suggestions (update 1).
Combine Weighitz, to create a portable smart body scale.
Weigh yourself or family members
The body weight app will allow tracking of your weight, BMI and will eventually be part of the healthy living app - this app will combine with the kitchen and automatic baking app to suggest healthy ways to achieve weight loss, gains or more specific goals - like muscle building. 
Our luggage app turns your whole suitcase into a smart weighing scale.
Weigh Luggage
See the weight adjust in real-time as you pack your luggage. Receive a warning when approaching baggage limits.
We are building apps based on the needs of our backers. In addition to the above-mentioned apps, we are producing two cool new apps our backers will love:  
Automatic Baking:
Baking based on weight is a simple yet precise method of baking. We are creating an app that will contain a variety of recipes based on the automatic baking concept. 
Smoothie Maker/Cocktail Maker:  
Like automatic baking. Follow simple weight-based recipes for delicious and healthy cocktails and smoothies.
What's your favourite?
We love to hear from our backers. We are going to take a poll after the campaign to determine our backers favorite apps. Then make them a reality.
When an object is placed on the surface, the top layer deforms. Weighing sensors under the cover detect slight deformations in the material.The force experienced by each Weighitz is measured and sent to the smartphone.
Depending on the app module you choose, the individual weights, combined weight or just raw readings can be viewed.
Single Scale ____________________ Set of Weighitz
We designed Weighitz to be attractive in any kitchen whilst being sturdy enough to be thrown in a gym bag.
We have optimized the dimensions to be sleek enough to fit into your pocket. A wide enough surface to hold the average kitchen plate/bowl & high enough to hold up a fabric suitcase
0.90"/2.3cm high - Required to keep larger pots/bowls and fabric suitcases from touching the ground when weighing.  
3.19"/8.1 cm Wide - Designed to be wide enough for a single unit to hold an average sized plate, bowl, large glass.
Designed for use in the kitchen and on the go. Weighitz are water resistant to IP4 level. This means you can wash them with a wet sponge but not submerge them in water.
The miniature design and magnetic base make for easy storage. Place them on the fridge for easy access.
Low power consumption and high capacity batteries combine so you rarely have to recharge. When required, plug in the micro USB cable and attach to your computer or wall socket. An indicator will light up when charged.
Micro-indents in the top and bottom surfaces make Weighitz non-slip. This makes it easy to place larger dishes on Weighitz with confidence.
BLE allows communication between the Weighitz and your smart device. BLE uses little energy which gives Weighitz a long battery life. BLE has a large range (approx 100m) which allows for remote weighing.
     Each Weighitz scale can weigh a wide range of weights with high accuracy and resolution. Each Weighitz can weigh up to 90lb with a resolution of 0.0002lb. 
Range and Resolution
    PLAY

Place a weight on a Weighitz and it sends that measurement to our application on your smart device. Our app will display the readings in both metric and imperial units. 
PLAY

Weighitz connects to your smart device through Bluetooth low energy (BLE). This allows us to connect multiple devices at once.
PLAY

  Each Weighitz will come in a choice of colors. Red, Blue, Green and Black. 
Choose a single color or a variety of colors for sets. You will then receive.
 A set of Weighitz will come with a single micro USB cable and plug. Request extras during the post-campaign survey. 
     Alan Kelly, is a clinical physicist and product developer. Having more than ten years experience in the medical field. He has now turned his mind to product development. Alan has advanced degrees in physics. He is also a graduate of the Intel & Haas School of business hardware development programs.
Dr. Poornima Kumar, is a world renowned neuroscientist and engineer. Poornima spends most of her time trying to understand the mechanisms behind depression. She still loves building things and used her engineering skills to help develop Weighitz.
 "We've been at this for a while: we came up with the idea for Weighitz two years ago and, green but enthusiastic, jumped into Kickstarter. That didn't work out, but since then we've pushed forward all the way to LA, bringing the product to the TBS show America's Greatest Makers. We were selected as one of the top 24 makers in the USA and got the support and advice of U.C. Berkeley, Haas School of Business, and some of Intel's best engineers. With their help, we've developed this to the point that we're finally happy and ready for a full product launch."
Original Product Video:
PLAY

We spent a long time refining and testing Weighitz.
Prototyping
 And finally came up with an amazing product. 
Now we need your backing to help us bring this product to life and mass manufacture - so don't forget to take advantage of our excellent early bird prices and back us now.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
"There are risks and challenges in all hardware projects, but we are mitigating them by working with some excellent manufacturing consultants.

For instance, our devices use Bluetooth and will need certification in all the regions we sell in. Certification is government run so can often be a complex process, we are minimizing these issues through careful engineering processes. There are also challenges in manufacturing and supply chain logistics, and there is always a chance that unexpected changes or issues may arise during the execution. But we are more than confident in our amazing manufacturer, who has extensive experience with kitchen and home products."
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Technically it's not difficult, at least at a high, conceptual level. Strain gauges, as on most electronic weight scales. I wanted to express my most sincere appreciation, for your move to manufacture this project in the US. Although I know it is not always possible, I really support projects being manufactured in their country of origin.

I have backed a moderate number of projects, over 200, and my recommendation, is always add 4 to 6 months to each project's planned delivery date. I have some projects that are over a year out, but I am not concerned. Of course, some projects do deliver on time. It is not reasonable to join a project, with the plan to have your reward available by a specific date (like Christmas). If you believe in the project, and the creator, be patient, attentive and supportive. Each project has a different set of challenges, and the path is not always straight. The goal is to receive the reward, which meets the highest standards of the creator.

campaign.story:
Music-Responsive LED Art projects can create beautiful, compelling light shows from your favorite songs. The only way to get a display that is perfect for you is to build your own - a challenging project requiring both hardware and programming skills. That's why we created Wave.
We designed BreadBro Wave to help you easily create beautiful, musically reactive LED art projects while you learn about computer programming and electronics hardware. After completing a project with Wave, not only will you have a beautiful piece of LED art, you'll also have an Open Source development board for any project you can imagine. 
While you build your project, you'll be learning the fundamentals of computer programming with Arduino, a programming language similar to C++. Even if you've never written a line of code before, Wave can help you create any musical light show that you can imagine.
  Wave makes it possible for beginners to create compelling LED projects, even with no prior experience, by building on the tools of the Open Source Hardware Community. Wave is built on an Arduino Uno R3 Footprint, and is compatible with Arduino shields and software.
Arduino makes it easy for you to upload small computer programs to a small computer chip. This chip can then control any electronic component - motors, buzzers, transmitters, LEDs, and much more.
This means that Wave can be programmed with the popular Arduino development environment, and that all the community resources of Arduino are fully compatible with Wave. If you need to, you can use Wave just like you would any other Arduino Uno R3.
If you've never written a computer program before, don't worry - we'll be providing a comprehensive set of both text- and video-based instructions and lessons. 
To use wave, simply plug it into your computer via a USB cable. Next, connect it to an audio source and a RGB LED strip. Start playing audio and watch the show!
Next, launch the Arduino software, and follow along as we help you build your own custom LED control software. Not only will you be learning computer programming - you'll be creating your own personal light show.
As you learn more and more about programming, you may want to use Wave as a standard Arduino. No problem - just disconnect your LED strip and audio cable, then use Wave as you would any other Arduino. When you're done, simply re-upload your LED firmware and carry on.
  BreadBro Wave makes a great addition to any Maker's toolkit. 
Wave is an Arduino Uno R3 - Compatible development board with an Atmel ATMega328P-AU microcontroller. USB-to-serial conversion is provided by an FTDI FT231XS-R IC. VIN from either header pin or barrel jack is regulated by an LM1117 5V LDO. Combined, these components provide a high-quality Uno R3 compatible development board.
An onboard 3.5mm TRRS headphone jack provides an easy way to provide any type of audio input. In the production version, we'll be providing both an "In" and "Out" headphone jack, to eliminate the need for a audio y-splitter. Left and right audio channels from the headphone jack are solder-selectable.
An MSGEQ7 Spectrum Analyzer IC by Mixed Signals provides hardware analysis of the input audio signal. The MSGEQ7 can be controlled using only around a dozen lines of code in your Arduino sketch. It provides seven analog values corresponding to the amplitude of specific frequency ranges.
Finally, an Onboard JST Connector provides an easy way to interface with WS2812B RGB LED strips, matrices, or modules. a provided inline 470-ohm resistor and 47uF electrolytic capacitor provide the recommended protection circuit for all WS2812B applications.
Wave takes a common project - sound-responsive LED artwork - and puts the necessary hardware on a board that can always be used as a standard Arduino clone. Save some space and reclaim your breadboard while keeping your artwork in place!
      BreadBro Wave is at an advanced stage of development. Our prototypes have been validated and we've ordered proofs of our final PCB design. We're launching this Kickstarter to help validate the market and to help figure out how many Waves we should build.
All BreadBro Technology products are hand-assembled in our facility in Austin, Texas. The only major component that we don't manufacture ourselves are depopulated circuit boards. This assembly method allows us to have complete control over testing, quality control, and supply chain. 
The funds from this Kickstarter Campaign will be used towards PCBs and components for assembly. Once the PCBs arrive, we will begin shipment in weekly batches of approximately 25 Waves per batch. As always, we'll keep you updated on our campaign, website, and social media platforms. Fulfillment should begin by the end of October.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any hardware startup, Wave faces some risks. One risk that we may face is delays in the manufacturing process.

We have mitigated this risk by taking complete control of our sourcing and assembly process. Other than bare PCBs, we assemble each and every Wave in a garage in Austin, Texas. We handle all of our sourcing directly with major domestic suppliers to ensure a steady supply chain. 

Another risk that Wave may face is in scaling. We are constantly identifying and quantifying any risk factors that may present themselves as we scale, particularly in labor and logistics. Even if our volume exceeds what we're capable of building right now, Wave's pricing model accounts for labor, facilities, and variable costs. 

Thanks for your interest in BreadBro Wave. Be sure to follow us on Facebook (/BreadBroTech), Twitter (@BreadBroTech), and our website, www.BreadBro.com.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi Backers! It's been a busy month, but we're on track!

We had a few minor delays regarding our LED supplier, but that's been worked out, and all of our kit components are ordered and on their way. This includes LED Strips, Power Supplies, Aux Cable, USB Cables and more.

We've finalized and ordered our production PCB design, incorporating two headphone jacks instead of just one, removing the need for a Y-connector. The PCBs are being fabricated now.

Hi Backers!

We did it! At over 1600% and with 245 of you supporting our project, Wave will be coming to life!
Here's what to expect over the next few weeks:

Based on our previous Kickstarter experience, we'll be recieving funds on or around September 9th. Immediately upon reciept of funds, we place our final orders for PCBs, components, and accesories. The lead times for these vary from under a day to over three weeks, so for most of September, parts will be trickling in.

In October, we start assembly. In our previous project, BreadBro, we have been doing hand - assembly. However, we're looking into partnering with a local PCB manufacturer, which could significantly speed up our production. In either case, Assembly will be finished before Halloween. There's a chance that it could happen faster. More on that in later updates.

After assembly is finished, it's on to testing and shipping! We're real sticklers for Quality Control, so it can take a bit of time, but it's worth it. Each and every Wave will be tested in an actual project, with actual Music, and the same LEDs and power supplies used in the kits.

Hi Backers! We're Mark, Steven and Tyler, the creators of Wave. It's been a whirlwind day, but we're already over our goal! We can't thank you enough. Just Wow.
We can't wait to see what you build with Wave. We're working on a couple of new demo projects as well to help you with some inspiration - we'll be linking to those videos in future updates.

campaign.story:
Get your Raspberry Shake now.
  Here goes a little bit of geeky stuff. Raspberry Shake is a single channel electronically extended 4.5 Hz geophone with an 24 bit digitizer sampled at 50 sps (samples per second) with the data presented in miniSEED format. What a mouth full!
In other words, Raspberry Shake is sensor-digitizer that records earthquakes from about magnitude 2 and higher within a radius of 50 miles, and a magnitude 4 and higher in a radius of 300 miles. It will also record earthquakes of larger magnitudes farther away but it will miss some of the subtleties. Raspberry Shake can detect and record short period (0.5 - 15 Hz) earthquakes; the farther away an earthquake, the less of that range of frequencies can be recorded.
Raspberry Shake is the little brother of the famous and popular OSOP Sixaola short-period six-channel seismograph.
The data will be displayed with the versatile SWARM software written for the USGS Alaska Volcano Observatory. This is open and free software.
  Raspberry Shake, your personal seismograph
        Raspberry Shake has two main components:
1) The main sensor is a geophone, a microphone for the vibrations of the earth. Geophones have been used for decades in the geophysical and oil exploration business. A geophone is a small can about the size of a salt shaker. There is a coil that moves in relation to a magnet and creates a small current.
2) The Amplifier, digitizer and ARM processor.
The small current mentioned above is then amplified with some ultra-quiet state of the art op amps. Once amplified, the signal is digitized, then that data are shipped to the ARM processor and bundled into one-second packets that are shipped to your Raspberry Pi.
The Raspberry Pi time-stamps the data and stores it in a seismic industry standard format and sends it in answer to client requests. Those requests are displayed on your smartphone or computer monitor. The complete system is called a seismograph.
The Raspberry Shake is for any person who would like to “see” the vibrations that are all around us but are generally not felt. ANY felt vibration whether it is a truck or a tremor will be detected by your Raspberry Shake. It's fun to make, fun to program, fun to watch the tremors and fun to review all of the recorded vibrations of the day on one screen.
If you don't have a Raspberry Pi yet, take a look to our "Magnitude 9.0 reward."
Don’t be fooled by the size and the price. Raspberry Shake is better than many of short-period seismometers in current use by the local networks of the USGS and many developing countries. Several software vendors have, for the first time, provided personal no-cost licenses for this project.
Raspberry Shake will make observatory quality data that can be shared in the worldwide standard SEED format. All modern automated seismology programs used by observatories can use the data from the Raspberry Shake. It's the Volkswagen of seismometers - yes there are Lamborgini seismographs but both the Lamborghini and the Volkswagen will get you from point A to point B.
These are some of the features included:
Display data in real time locally or remotely, which means you can place your Raspberry Shake in a quiet location and see the data via internet. 
Store data in SEED format (Standard for Exchange of Earthquake Data). 
Allow sharing of real time data. Seedlink Protocol. Send alarms by email or Telegram. Off-the-shelf parts.
Support by email and Whatsapp. 
Creats daily wave summary as a helicorder or spectrogram.
Display-quality case. 
Industrial quality geophone sensor. 
Industrial quality 4 layer board and surface mount components.
The Raspberry Shake board has four major circuit blocks:
The power conditioning section.
The analog front end with the signal conditioners and the amplifiers.
The digitizer section where the analog signals are converted to ones and zeros.
The main processor where the digital signals are bundled and sent via RS232 to the Raspberry Pi.
Device specifications
The Raspberry Shake shield is compatible with almost all Raspberry Pi models. With any Raspberry Pi B, B+, 2 B and 3 you should be able to see waves coming from Raspberry Shake. 
The shield uses only three signal connections in addition to the Power and Ground pins.
Raspberry Shake graphic device specifications
This is how you connect your Raspberry Shake to Raspberry Pi. Just plug it into the top of the Raspberry Pi's 40 pin header (or the 26 pin header for other models).
Raspberry Shake is a module easy to plug into your Raspberry Pi
 On the 40 pin header the Raspberry Shake use five pins:
Power / RPi Pin 2 
Ground / RPi Pin 6 
TX / RPi Pin 8 
RX / RPi Pin 10 
Reset / RPi Pin 15 / GPIO 22
All other pins are unused. As you can see, if you are a tinkerer, a maker, a hobbyist or an EE you can connect the Raspberry Shake to any single board computer that has TX/RX.
  The Raspberry Shake team has huge experience creating seismometers (we do it for a living) and it's our passion. We have all kinds of instruments and are constantly seeking ways to make more and better ones.
The Raspberry Shake is a little brother of a seismograph for local and regional earthquakes that our team makes for universities and national seismic observatories. We sell one model for several thousand dollars. We have taken the same geophone sensor, made the electronics a bit simpler and mounted it all on a Raspberry Pi. Then adapted the software to work on the Raspberry Pi. Once that was done, we could use Open Source Software used by the USGS. The data is stored in a format fully compatible with the USGS and seismic observatories all over the world. If you choose, you can share your data with the rest of the world.
Along with the book Personal Seismology you can learn the basics of recognizing small local and regional earthquakes. In many cases these quakes are undetectable because the government observatories don’t have enough stations and the detectable energy from small quakes does not travel far.
You can set up a web page that shows the data in the form of a helicorder and share that data. The USGS program Heli_ewII makes the capture of the data for daily helicorders and web page creation easy.
Several small earthquakes
In the image below you can see several small earthquakes, once you know what to look for. With other tools covered in the book Personal Seismology you can expand and analyze those small quakes.
SWARM graphic interface in helicorder mode
The figure above shows the graphic user interface that has been produced by the USGS’s famous and popular program called SWARM (which you will download for free). What you see is 24 hours of continuous data in a format that used to be called a helicorder and some seismologists now call a webicorder. The red indicators show where certain user-selectable limits were exceeded and are small earthquakes. The expanded section shows a “text book” local earthquake about 30 kilometers away and around a magnitude 3. The book Personal Seismology will explain how to use SWARM and how to estimate the distance and magnitude. 
Raspberry Shake will allow you to monitor ground motion from your computer terminal or smartphone. You will be able to record the motion of 24 hours for your review in a single screen and examine close-up any little portion of the recording.
Comparison between Raspberry Shake (upper) and Nanometric Trillium Compact (lower)
The image above shows how your Raspberry Shake roughly compares to a $50,000 professional seismograph. The upper expanded image is from a Raspberry Shake and the lower expanded image is from a Nanometric Trillium Compact broadband sensor connected to a Kenda Earthdata true 24 bit digitizer. Both charts show the same regional earthquake.
Being able to do this is simply remarkable. Just a few years ago it was possible with massive investments that only governments and universities could afford. Raspberry Shake brings this ability to everyone.
Movers and Shakers: Thanks for your contribution! Get updates, and be on the Movers and Shakers section of our website.
This is the complete guide to personal seismology with your Raspberry Shake. We explain in simple non-technical terms and many examples what you see and how to interpret it. It covers all aspects of enjoying your Raspberry Shake. You will also be on our Movers and Shakers section.
This is our main benefit. This board plugs right on to Raspberry Pi and start sends data through the RS232 serial port.
 If you already have your Raspberry Pi, this reward is for you. You get the Raspberry Shake board and the seismic sensor, the geophone. These are brand new and tested to make sure that you get the most out of your seismograph.
This gives you everything except for the Raspberry Pi itself. Add the RPi and things will boot right up.
  How you assemble your Raspberry Shake kit
This is the full meal deal, ready to run right out of the box. You get a fully functional seismograph that is better than what some third world observatories have. It includes all of the hardware and all of the software. You can be up and running in no time. You will also get direct personal support via the community forum, email and Whatsapp.
The team at OSOP is 14 members strong! Only four of us are directly working on Raspberry Shake, but we could not do it without the rest of the team, especially the programmers. Raspberry Shake utilizes several thousand hours of code that OSOP has produced and many many more hours of other people's open source code. 95% of the work is in the software and it is the software that makes Raspberry Shake special. Raspberry Shake speaks in the language of SEED: Standard for Exchange of Earthquake Data. This language makes it a real seismograph and not a curiosity that makes wiggly lines. We especially thank the team that wrote GFZ Seiscomp 2.6 and the team that wrote USGS SWARM. Special thanks to OSOP team members Dave, Thomas and Branden. 
  $15,000 We will write the software so you can securely share your data through a central server with other Raspberry Shake users and national seismic observatories. Even more importantly, the data from your Shake will be available to the USGS and other national seismic networks.
$25,000 We will make a website to display all the shared Raspberry Shake stations around the world on an interactive web-based real-time world map.
$50,000 We will provide real time automatic global earthquake locations on your computer using your Raspberry Shake, other Raspberry Shakes and open seismic stations. This will be a better network than many nations had just a scant 10 years ago. $50,000 will make this happen!
Most of the work is done. Raspberry Shake is working. Most of the components are off the shelf: geophone, RPi. We make the acrylic box in our shops. This Kickstarter campaign will allow us to make the production version of the Raspberry Shake board. We will also unify all the little bits of software and get them to be nice to each other.
We will have product in the mail late October or early November, in time for gift-giving. Here is our timeline:
Thank you so much for checking us out! We hope to have you on board very soon. Please drop us a line or leave a comment in the campaign if you have any questions, we would be happy to help you.
   Check out our Press Kit: https://github.com/osopsa/raspberryshake-press-releases
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We don’t see much risk but of course it exists. Most of the viewing and analysis software is already in day to day scientific use by the USGS. When we raise our pledge amount we will have enough funds for the first run of boards, and after that it is mostly carpentry. Most of the risk is in terms of delays in time to delivery; everything will be on track if we make no changes to the hardware and do not add any new software. As makers we always want to tinker and improve things and I know that we are looking at some different op amp. We promise to weigh every decision in relation to the promised delivery time. We will post updates often.

We promise that when we make our goal, all of our supporters will get their Raspberry Shake, and we will also give you any and all the support you need to get it up and running.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Stay up-to-date with the Raspberry Shake Newsletter
updates.update_content:
Hi Raspberry Shakers!
Buenas noches!
After November 26th, I exported all of your email addresses from the Kickstarter platform and added you to our Raspberry Shake Community Newsletter to stream line communication.

updates.update_userinfo: Raspberry Shakes are on their way to the USA and rest of the world
updates.update_content:
Shake Community!
We want to say hello and share some great news. The last two weeks have been amazing and busyyyyy. As we work, we are ever mindful that soon more than 500 of our supporters will connect their Raspberry Shakes for the very first time! Everyone on the Raspberry Shake is energized by this. And, as you expected, this week we started to ship all of the Raspberry Shakes. Yesterday at office we had a little celebration for all of the work done.

updates.update_userinfo: Software and shipping news and more
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
The software will be done and bundled this week. It looks great. We will deliver everything in Docker containers. In this way we can avoid the dependency mess. You will be able to download the SD card images from a public git repository.
We will be shipping this month as promised. Some backer rewards will ship from the USA and some from Panama.

updates.update_userinfo: New pinout diagrama and more things coming out
updates.update_content:
Dear Raspberry Shake Community:
¡Viva Panama! Yesterday was a very important day in Panama. On November 3, 1903 we declared independence from Colombia. And we consider it our national independence day much like the 4th of July in the USA. And Yes, your Raspberry Shake was designed and made in Panama. We are celebrating!

updates.update_userinfo: Raspberry Shake are here and ready for testing!
updates.update_content:
Hello Shakers!
The Raspberry Shake boards have arrived at our offices in Volcan, Panama!
At the beginning of the week part of the Raspberry Shake team met to discuss manufacturing, testing and shipping details.

Hello Raspberry Shake community:
It's been awhile since the last update. Since then, we have made a LOT of progress!
For starters, one week ago we received a mountain of Raspberry Pi 3's and geophones:

updates.update_userinfo: The $25,000 and $50,000 Stretch Goals are ready!
updates.update_content:
Hello Raspberry Shake Community:
We are happy to announce the launch of EQView and StationView. These web-based earthquake monitoring applications, developed by our collaborators at Gempa GmbH in Germany, provide up-to-the-minute earthquake and station information, fulfilling the $25,000 and $50,000 stretch goals from our Kickstarter campaign. We will continue working with our colleagues in Germany to tailor these web-based applications to our needs and create a truly awesome web-based user experience. We would love to hear your feedback.

updates.update_userinfo: Raspberry Shake v4 has arrived at OSOP office
updates.update_content:
Hi Raspberry Shake community:
We have LOTS of good news to share!
The first 4 production boards have arrived at OSOP and are running! And boy do they look great! It took several iterations to get things done exactly as we wanted but it was worth the wait. While we wait for the next 696 boards to arrive (~2 weeks) we will use these 4 boards for testing and development. We are currently ahead of schedule with the hardware and have begun in earnest to get the software done in time for our November 15th shipping goal.

updates.update_userinfo: Raspberry Shake Store & Google Forum is here!
updates.update_content:
Hello community:
The Raspberry Shake Shop is online, we are still adjusting some of the prices and adding things but it is mostly working. Please spread the word. We are coming up with a 3’s price for the Magnitude 9 since we have had several request for that. What would you like added to the store? Here is an image of the shop.

Dear backers:
For us it's a pleasure to announce that our section Movers and Shakers is live on our website. This is a sneak peek of how it looks:

campaign.story:
We’re back!
In 2013 we ran a successful Kickstarter for our first 5 extruder 3D printer the MH3000. We received a lot of feedback from our awesome user community and in 2014 we launched our second successful Kickstarter for the RoVa3D - the updated version of our 5 extruder system. We delivered every 3D printer pledged for from both of those campaigns!! And we've since sold many hundreds more of the RoVa3D and had 2 more years of market feedback from our growing customer base. Well, you've spoken and we've listened again. We are here today to introduce you to our 6th generation 3D printer: The RoVa4D
Your TV is full color, your cell phone is full color, your office paper printer is full color, shouldn't your 3D printer be full color too?
We think so! That is why we have added this new dimension to our newest 3D printer.
  ********UPDATE since launching the campaign: We have decided with the input from our current backers that we will increase the print height to 18 inches!  The build volume is now 12 x 12 x 18 instead of 12 x 12 x 12! ********
    What is Full Color Blending?
The RoVa4D works by extruding separate cyan, magenta, yellow, black, and white filaments into a single patent pending hot end where they are blended together and deposited from a single nozzle. This works similarly to your inkjet printer at home except that we also need white filament, since we aren't printing on paper.  This lets you print unlimited colors in a single print. The materials can be printed with a gradient or as hard separations. The printer switches colors by purging the difference in a little bin (just like your inkjet) or to reduce the waist the transition can happen inside the infill area of the print provided that it's large enough. The RoVa4D has 3 separate hot ends.  One is capable of printing in any color, hue, tone, tint or shade. The second one is dedicated to flexible materials like Ninjaflex, and the third one is dedicated to dissolvable support material.  If you want you can switch between all three during a single print. 
How Does it Work?
What about Blending Materials?
Not only can it blend CMYK+W to create any color in the rainbow, but our new printer can ALSO blend PLA based materials, like hard and soft to create an infinitely variable hardness of material.  Five different materials go into one hot end and they are mixed together to produce new material. Combining these together you can create hybrids of each one. It works the same as the color, but instead of creating a new color, they blend together and create a material with new properties.
During our Kickstarter you have the choice to include with your reward either a CMYK+W filament pack (5 in total), or the multi-material pack which will include: Carbon Fiber, Wood, Transparent, Metal Filled (sinterable metal), and Soft Material (5 in total). Or you can choose to get both so you can switch between color mixing and material mixing (please see the information regarding rewards further down the page).  You can also substitute other PLA based materials yourself, but the base polymers have to be compatible and that may require some testing. These are just the ones that we are supplying, that we have tested.
Saves you Money in Printing Materials:
What we think is the absolute best feature of the printer is the ability to choose any color you want. You can color match to a picture and have the correct colors instantaneously without needing to shop around on the web trying to find the right ones.It eliminates the problem of buying a specific color of filament to print one small part and then having to store it on the shelf because you don't have an immediate use for it, or perhaps it ended up not being the color you wanted after all.  What a waste of money!  Because now you are onto ordering the next color you need or want to try. Or perhaps it is the complete opposite and you find yourself in the middle of a print and you run out of the color you special ordered in and have to go re-order only to find that when it arrives it is a different shade because it was made in a different batch, but sold as the same product. Again, what a waste of money and time spent waiting.
That's the value proposition. With this printer you will get consistency in color, and you can just pick the color you need from an infinite pallet. It's easier and faster. Pick the colors calibrated to the Pantone scale or use the rgb or cmyk codes from a color picker. Finally the things you print can look like the things you wanted to print. It's one less step of processing. You don't have to paint your models after the fact they simply come off the bed completed.
One color is no longer boring when every print can be a different custom color on the fly.  We've taken 3D printing and added a new dimension to it. Color. What if you printed a fish in a green ocean because you ran out of blue. The effect would be devastating. (Trust us, we've been there).
For schools it adds one more step of involvement in that the students can color the models and contribute more to the process.
Imagine how much more organized and efficient your filament stock room can be if you only need to stock 5 colors and from those 5 you can produce ANY color, hue, tint, shade, or tone in the rainbow!
Simplified Work Flow:
One of the biggest complaints we got about our 5 nozzle printer was that there aren't enough 5 color models out there. (Well that's not really about the printer but we solved that problem anyway.) In the past in order to produce a multi-colored part you would need to have a model that would have multiple segments. The printer wouldn’t know which color was loaded into a particular extruder, so you had to make sure it was loaded with the correct color into the correct extruder. Once that was done you then assigned that extruder to a particular part, so that when it was printing that part of the model the printer would use that extruder and therefore that color would come through. You almost have to be a graphic design artist in order to be able to do that.
With our Simplified Work Flow, what we have done is make it so that you can take any single body model (like the millions that are available on Thingiverse and on the web), and color them in one of 2 ways:
1.) You can simply wrap any picture onto the model - you can take a photo or something you have designed in Photoshop like a logo, and wrap it onto any shape like a vase, block, etc.
2.) You can paint the model with a size variable brush using a color picking wheel, and selecting the color in the computer, virtually painting it so that when you print it – it will print in those exact colors. You don’t need to switch out the filaments to get those colors. You simply leave the CMYKW loaded in the machine, ready to print. The printer knows which color is in each of the extruders and it knows which extruder is for cyan, which is for magenta, etc. It combines in the ratio that is required for that color into the mixing chamber where it is mixed/blended together to produce the new color, and that is what comes out of the nozzle and is what is printed.  We've made it really easy to make ANY 3D model into a multi-color model. It's so easy that anyone can do it. It's as simple as:
1) Pick your model 2) Paint the model 3) Print the model
Just 3 simple steps and every model is a full color model! You will find that the process is not only fun but also easy enough for a child to use. Now everyone can easily use this new printer to create full color 3D prints even if they aren't a graphic designer.
Example of Painting a Gecko:
 More models painted and ready to print:
Some sample prints:
** For even more print samples make sure to go through our updates!
  Working on Color Matching:
We Love a Challenge:
Prototype Video Footage:
** For even more print videos make sure to check out all of the updates!
   
Commercial Quality at Maker Prices:
If you have seen our printers before you know our printers are made to last, and that every component of our printers has been custom engineered. 
The Frame: The printer frame is STRONG! It is not just an all metal frame. It is ¼ inch aerospace grade aluminum, anodized to perfection and reinforced by a ½ inch aluminum internal frame with rear metal cross braces (Like how you would reinforce the back end of a racing car.) We do all of this so that you can run it really fast with a head that is fed with 7 separate extruders without it wobbling around – it is still rock solid.
We are incorporating what we learned over 6 generations of 3d printer designs to improve the basic geometry of the printer to get the maximum build volume into the minimum foot print.
Enclosure: One of the other things that customers asked for was a smaller enclosure, so we went to a core x/y system , so that it’s not only a smaller enclosure but now the print bed only moves up and down on the z and the print head moves in the x/y axis. Core x/y is more accurate and more repeatable than any other linear motion system.
The enclosure is part of the printer and further stiffens the entire chassis. The printer is also impact tested according to the safety standards for use in a home, school, or office. The enclosure is also lockable and will fail in a locked position. If it is hot inside it will not be allowed to open until the printer is stationary and cooled down. (See Update #5)
Gears & Pulleys:  We don’t 3d print the components that are on our printers, we have them injection molded or machined from aluminum. That makes them significantly stronger. All of our gears are stainless steel, our pulleys are metal, the belts we use are designed for linear motion.
  Hot ends: Our hot ends are also made of aluminum so they heat up very quickly. They have powerful heaters in them, and our nozzles are zinc coated copper, so they are durable as well as great heat conductors. The best that any metal can be. And they seal more easily and don’t leak, because they use a proprietary gasket technology to seal them.
Dedicated Nozzles: There is a dedicated nozzle for support material and one for flexible material.  The reason these are separate is because the base polymers of different materials don’t play nicely with the PLA of the full color nozzles. In order to print completely different materials they have to be separate hot ends.  We have engineered them to have the best optimal performance for those particular materials. Our Ninjaflex extruder and hot end were engineered specifically to print in flexible materials. They print easily and fast. If you were to mix them into our full color hot end, they would need to be printed at such vastly different temperatures that it would be impossible. Because we have separate hot ends and because of our liquid cooling system we are able to keep each of the hot ends at precisely the temperature that they are set to. The dissolvable support material hot end can be at 160 Celsius, and the full color hot end can be at 210. The liquid cooling system is so efficient it will allow them to maintain that precise separation between their temperatures. Having three hot ends that are dedicated to different materials will allow you to print materials that are completely incompatible with each other, all in the same print.
Liquid Cooling: All hot ends have a hot and a cold section and our competition uses air cooling which leads to jamming problems. The enclosure is sealed so it gets hot inside, this helps to prevent warping of the printed parts but if you use a fan to cool the hot end inside the enclosure you are just blowing hot air.  We employ a liquid cooling system that circulates cold water through the hot end, and pumps the heat out of the enclosure where it is cooled in an external radiator (kind of like your car).  This is far more efficient than a fan, and eliminates issues like jamming that our competition suffers from.
Build Volume: You can print any object that is up to 12 inches x12 inches x18 inches. The actual build volume is closer to 12.5 inches on the X and Y. Why? Because you can’t use 12 inches on the X/Y/Z if it is actually only 12 inches, as you cannot print right on the edge. So we are giving you a buffer so that you can actually print 12 x 12 x 18!
 Geckotek Plates: They are interchangeable plates for different materials so you don’t have to prepare the beds yourself, and after the print is finished if you are going to do multiple back to back prints you can leave the bed hot, take the plate off to cool down, and put another plate on and just keep printing. Print materials stick so well there is no warping or delamination that can occur on the bed – it’s amazing and we love this product - which is why we are including it in every order.
RoVa3D Full Color Blender Features:
Some of the amazing features of the RoVa4D include: automatic bed leveling, auto nozzle height control, electronic offset control, heated bed, tool-less setup, liquid cooling for jam free prints, all-metal 450C hot ends, automatic print layer cooling fan, wireless full color touch screen, wi-fi printing and video updates, and a full metal frame, stainless steel gears, and a 12X12X12 inch build volume. Below you can see a full list of the features.  We will expand on these in our upcoming updates:
    RoVa4D Technical Specs:
Reward Levels:
To make the ordering process as simple as possible each reward will include the same items.
Your reward package will include:
3D printer with full CMYKW color mixing head with all of the above features
Flexible Material head AND Support Material head
Wireless printing and wireless touch interface to the printer.
Comes with 5 PLA CMYKW color filament spools OR 5 Multi Material spools and 1 PVA and 1 RoVa-Flex filament spools (for a total of 7 Filament spools)
A full lockable safety enclosure
Quick Start Kit
12^3 build volume
Geckotek Quick Change Bed and 2 Quick Change plates for printing PLA, ABS & Nylon
Extended Full One Year Warranty
RoVaSlice Custom Printing Design Software for full color printing
Free shipping in Canada and Continental USA
Please note: If you live outside of North America, please select which batch you want and contact us with your full shipping address so that Brittany or Jenn can get you a price as quickly as possible. Once you have the shipping price you can increase your pledge to include the shipping.
EARLY BIRD BATCH 1 (25 available): RoVa4D 3D printer for $4500 CAD (Delivery 03/17)
Each batch will include the same items/ package, with an increase of $100 per batch of printers with a delivery date one month later.

BETA UNIT EXPEDITED (10 available): RoVa4D printer for $6500 CAD (Delivery 11/16)
Want your printer first? We will use expedited manufacturing/pre-production parts to get you your printer within 3 months of the Kickstarter ending.  We will work with you to perfect our painting software prior to shipping the rest of the printers.
EXISTING CUSTOMER UPGRADE KIT: $2000 CAD (Delivery 03/17)
Already have an MH3000 or RoVa3D 5 Extruder 3D Printer and not ready for a new printer yet? We have an upgrade reward for you! *This upgrade is for customers only as you need to have the 5 extruder set up & liquid cooling for this to work.

Included in the upgrade kit:
Full Color Hot End, the color mixer, liquid cooling block, the heater, temperature sensor, 5 new upgraded extruders with generic cartridges, pack of 10 new style nozzles, automatic bed leveling sensor, print layer cooling fan and manifold, wireless controller, tablet, 5 spools of filament CMYKW and the set of 5 Multi Material filaments (so 10 spools in total) and shipping is included within Canada and the Continental USA.
FILAMENT: **If you want the 5 CMYKW AND 5 Multi Material Spools (Carbon Fiber, Wood, Transparent, and metal filled, and soft material) please add $250 CAD to your pledge.
RoVa4D T-SHIRT: $25 CAD (Delivery 10/2016) Don’t need a 3D printer but want to help out? Get a t-shirt! * Design isn't finalized, but it will be sweet!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have done this before, and have been in business for several years selling 3D printers. This is our 6th generation 3D printer and we are happy to say we have delivered every printer that was ever paid for on Kickstarter or otherwise. You can trust us because we've proven that you can. Take advantage of this bulk order price for the launch of our new product. After this campaign there will be a pre-order available on our website but the price will be between this and the MSRP. Also it will be for the printer only not the package offered on the Kickstarter. Once we've delivered the KS printers the price will be adjusted to the full MSRP so act now before all the batches are spoken for.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

sorry to hear. You cant fail if you never quit. Better times will come. wish you guys the best. I truly believe you gave it your all.

I'm very sorry to read your latest update. I can't think of anything harder to go through than the death of a dream. You have my confolences. May you be blessed in the future and find support this trouble.

People offered to pay extra to help you finished the 4D and you ignored everyone. I would have way more preferred you ask me for $3,000 more to finish the Rova 4D. This has become a complete mess.
Back in July you didn't say anything about a $3,000 minimum. That's means those that have paid the most so far get to keep that distinction. Yeah I get to pay more than anyone else.
I know. I know. I don't have to buy an HT. I can wait for you to run out of money and not get my Rova 4D.
HOW IS THAT A SMALL UPDATE!?!?! You went from saying a discounted price - pledge amount ... to you have to PAY FULL RETAIL PRICE!!!! Now essentially $10,000 for a printer I didn't want.
Anyone want to or know someone who would want to by an HT? I would sell my bid at cost.

But I really would have rather had a crappy kind a sort of color printer, then a 2 color nylon printer. Who wants to print nylon. At least it has a 12 inch print width. Ever seen a V8 commercial, D'OH I could have had a Z18. ;-)
Btw when I said I emailed Jenn, I meant that I told her to switch me to an HT.

As far as I know we still don't know the final price of the HT. Has that been determined (and I missed it), if so what was that number?
I don't think we know how much more it will cost to get the HT. I know in my case ORD hasn't had a chance let me know. My guess is that it won't be anywhere near $3,000.
Also as a afterthought, folks that backed early bird at a reduced cost now pay more for the HT.

Mistakes are made and reality is reality no matter how much you want something else. Lets hope we learn from our mistakes and move forward. For me I am excited about getting something out this process when I knew from the start that I was risking getting nothing at all. I could do alot with the HT.

A more realistic path for you would be to provide an "option" for backers who are willing, to provide incremental funds to finish off their individual printers. I for one would participate. More important, this may convince a financial investor that there is value. Just a thought.

From experience, a frequent factor in print failure for overnight prints is actually the attached PC rebooting for some reason or simply dropping connection. Given that even optimised colour switching is likely to lead to some complex RoVa4D prints taking a very long time, this becomes a concern with the currently envisaged options. Even deactivating automatic Windows maintenance does not always reliably eliminate this problem. I can imagine that the added complexity of colour-mixing and multiple nozzles may require ongoing interaction with the PC slicing/control software, but if this is not the case it might be worth envisaging an SD card option (with Control Panel). I know this is often seen as old-fashioned and limiting, but several of the most reliable printers on the market (e.g. Ultimaker 2+) make successful use of this option and I do find that it can help with peace of mind - I have used both machines that require constant Wifi/USB connection to a PC and those that can also use an SD card, and I know which I prefer for long prints. Roger

campaign.story:
The LittleArm
  The LittleArm was a weekend project that has grown into a full-time project and business. This campaign is to get the ball rolling.
I wanted a robot arm. But even the kits are expensive, for what they deliver. So one weekend I grabbed a few high strength microservos and went to work designing the parts to have printed.
At the end of the weekend I had a couple of different versions of the robot. I took it to work and everyone loved to play with it and I soon had a couple of people ask me to print them one.
First 2-DOF Prototype
  The first prototype
Later, I was doing some demonstrations for STEM teachers. They also loved the idea, and they asked me to make them some for their classes. 
So I decided to turn my little maker project into an actual product at Slant Robotics.
This campaign is to raise funds for building software and tutorials on using the arm and to purchase several 3-D printers and other supplies in order to produce the arms in greater quantities. 
3-D printed
The LittleArm is a completely open source project. I made it 3-D printed so that anyone can download the parts and start using it. It also ensures that the arm can be rapidly changed and developed for different applications, without being constrained by molds.
Arduino
The arm is controlled entirely by an Arduino Uno. The Uno provides a decent amount of support and is very versatile. These qualities allow almost anyone to start programming the arm and add other features like sensors.
Arduino is also supported on platforms such as Blockly,  so beginners can write programs graphically.
Interchangeable End-Effectors
The arm is designed to have a modular gripper. While there is a servo to actuate a gripper I have also designed several rigid end-effectors for different tasks.
  Wrist, Claw, and Hook
Software
If you want to use the GUI or create some other complex program, you need more than the Arduino. All other software, is entirely based in Python. Python is a simple language to learn and has a large amount of support.
Most of the foundational programs have been created. Kinematics are done. We have a basic GUI. And best of all we have a "record" function so you can train the robot to perform a task and then watch it go.
That is the start, but honestly the number of programs that can be created for an arm like this is big.
We could set-up a webcam and add vision. We could have some basic sensors so that it follows a laser pointer. We could make it play with a ball. (Oh wait, we did that)
But in order to create all of those programs we need a little money and a bit of help. We would love it if anyone who is interested in the project shares their code with us on our website.
Early Version of GUI
Website
We have already created a basic website to support the arm. It started as a project blog, so it is a bit rough. But we are working on getting it upgraded.
In the future the website will contain all resources needed to build, work with, and teach with the LittleArm.
Uses
STEM
So many of the programming kits out there are just too complicated and quickly become boring. How many times does it take to make a robot follow a line before the kids decide the idea is stupid? Plus many of those "build" kits just have a bunch of pieces waiting to be lost.
This arm is a great kit that doesn't have many pieces to lose, can take a kid through every part of engineering, from design to programming, and always has something else to add.
Imagine a class project where kids have to create an assembly line with their robot arms. Or they create a small group of synchronized dancing robots. Maybe they train the robot to feed the science class lizard. While this arm is simple it can do a ton of stuff.
Hobby
There are a lot of hobby arms out there. But they are all expensive, and they are really not very helpful because they depend on a 'community' to make it interesting. 
This arm is so basic that anyone with a any kind of experience can easily create programs from scratch. And while we like and want a community, it is not a necessity to use this arm.
Research
Yes, that is what was just said. This arm can be used for a number of different research purposes. In fact I am working on a small project in deep learning right now with the arm. It is a whole lot easier to test software on this arm than on a large industrial robot. And since deep learning requires data, it is a lot cheaper to get 100 of these arms to provide data than a single industrial arm.
But that is all nerd stuff. No one really cares about that.
Actual Home Use
Have you ever forgotten to feed the fish. This arm could be programmed to do it. Maybe someone at the table needs a mint. This arm could broach the subject.  Maybe it could scratch your cat's belly. Maybe it could put the sugar in your coffee. Maybe you need a Rube Goldberg method of turning on a light.
We don't expect anyone to make these an official part of their home. This section is just an excuse to present some other ideas.
What is Included in a Kit
4 MG90S metal-geared microservos
1 Arduino Uno (unless ordering Brainless)
All required fasteners and connectors
1 6V power supply
1 mini breadboard
All 3D printed components (colors vary)
1 actuated gripper assembly
1 pen-holding gripper
Connector wires for breadboard
All the Parts in the Kit (Minus the Tools)
 Other Rewards
Build the Uprising T-Shirt
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have been working in robotics for nearly ten years. This project is basic.

I have already sourced all the materials and resources and am ready to upload the files to the printer to start making preorders. Additionally since it is being supported by Slant Robotics there are a lot of resources and talent to draw from within the business.

The largest challenge will be creating enough tutorials and software to make this robot easy and fun to learn on. That will be an ongoing process but the architecture has been laid out and a lot of those resources have already been created. Right now an eighth grade kid could learn to use what we have available. We're trying to get it down to a 3rd grade kid, or lower.

We have detailed how to use Blockly for the robot and are creating web interfaces to eliminate the need for configuring python on the computer. And there is a small online video class in the works to walk anyone through the entire robot.

The largest challenge on the hardware side is printing the arms in quantity. Printing can be unreliable. But we have designed several new methodologies for ensuring quality prints most of the time. This ensures that we can use printing at a greater scale.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Version 3 of the LittleArm is Funded but Still Open for Preorders
updates.update_content:
Hey All,
It has been nearly 4 years since we first launched the LittleArm. And we have continued to grow and improve the kits.
We just released the latest version of the LittleArm. The LittleArm V3. It is a total design refresh. And we are very proud of what we have done. The original LittleArm was a solid effort but now we have taken 4 years of design experience and feedback and put it all into one more kit.

Hey Everyone.
Wow. You are all the original backers. The first ones. The ones that started it all. Wow. It has been nearly 3 years since the LittleArm Launched. Since then we have created 9 other robotics kits and we are still going strong. Thank you all for backing the original Littlearm. With its bad video and all the other rough edges. You literally got this whole project started.
Version 3 of the LittleArm  is coming soon

Hey Everybody,
Hope you are all enjoying your LittleArms. We just wanted to give an update of what has happened to the LittleArm since this campaign finalized. 
The LittleArm is now an international product. It is available to almost anywhere in the world. Our website is filled with all kinds of content and we are starting to get active users developing things with the LittleArm.

updates.update_userinfo: Happy New Years - International Shipping and Something New
updates.update_content:
Hello Everyone,
Happy New Year.
We have made a couple of resolutions for 2017. Here they are.
First we are now offering international shipping on all orders of the LittleArm. The response has been great. Thanks everyone.

Hey All,
A few weeks ago we posted about a watered-down application launching to control the LittleArm. Well the full version is now available.
Using bluetooth and the LittleArm android app you can control and train your LittleArm just as you would with the desktop app, no wires attached.

Hey All,
Just wanted to let you know that we launched the ShopArm today.
If you missed our last update, the ShopArm is a large robot arm for makers, education, and small business. It is easily trained using either, speech, vision, or our GUI.

Hey All,
Thanks one last time for all your support. We put our first batch of LittleArms into  toy stores just a few weeks ago so it is going great, because of you guys.
We have also just launched a basic Android App for the LittleArm if you have a bluetooth module. Here is the link to the App. We will be posting wiring diagrams and other resources on the in the next few weeks. If you have the module already just upload our normal Arduino code and start using it.

Hey Everybody.
Happy Halloween! You know most of the Halloween candy bowls are really boring. We decided to spice them up with the LittleArm. So we grabbed some pipe cleaners and made a costume for the LittleArm.

Hey Everyone,
By now you have all received your LittleArms (if you haven't let us know, because that is bad). How is it going? 
Can we ask you guys for your help? We are putting together a video class about the arduino, and based around the LittleArm. Any particular topics you guys would like to see? Any knowledge that has been invaluable to you, or you would like to yet learn?

Hey All,
Well we made it. Not quite as far ahead of schedule as we would have liked, but compared to other Kickstarter projects, we were pretty darn amazing.
Today we are shipping the last few packages of the campaign. Wrapping up this chapter of the LittleArm project. (If you don't receive your reward in the next 5-10 days let us know and we will duel the mailing service for your package)

campaign.story:
The P1 is a bold, modular design that reduces the amount you carry by combining two commonly used items, a pen and flashlight, into a single functional and innovative package.
The body is Grade 5 titanium, offering a modern, element resistant shell that houses the internal components. It comes in two finishes, polished or a matte, bead blast, each giving the P1 its own distinct appearance.
Overall dimensions are a compact 4.65” (118mm) in length, with a diameter of 0.55” (14mm) and weight of 1.7 oz (48g). This makes the P1 a perfect fit for every day carry. 
The pen retracts using an intuitive, bolt action mechanism. Moving the bolt over presents the pen tip and a small red dot indicates the P1 is live and ready to write.
The P1 ships with a waterproof fine, black Lamy M22 rollerball insert. The refill is readily available and comes in different tip sizes as well as blue. The conical end of the pen has a long thread to ensure it securely holds the components in place. Thin grooves have been machined into the body to provide comfort and grip.
The water resistant flashlight module is fastened to the body with a combined magnet and twist lock feature, allowing it to be used both as a single piece or on its own.
The circuit is based around a CREE XP-G2 emitter, chosen for its small yet powerful specifications. There are two modes available by a twist interface. Turning the grippy, knurled bezel, step-cycles through a low, 9 lumen mode and up to a high 130 lumen mode.
A single 10180 battery powers the light. It is is fully removable and rechargeable via a micro USB port. The port is cleverly hidden beneath the head cap and recessed below the threads where it is protected from liquid or impact damage when not in use. The charging port has a small led that indicates a full charge by turning from red to green.
Extending the light’s functionality, the magnet can be attached to metal surfaces for hands-free operation. The optional quick release cap allows the light to be carried on a keychain.  
If carrying the light only, the overall length is 1.95" (49.5mm) including the removable (OPTIONAL) cap with a weight of 0.78 oz (22g).
Grade 5 Titanium
Overall Dimensions: 4.65" x 0.55" (118mm x 14mm)
Overall Weight: 1.7 oz (48g)
Flashlight Dimensions: 1.95" x 0.55" (49.5mm x 14mm)
Flashlight Weight: 0.78 oz (22g)
2 Mode Light: 9 lumen low, 130 lumen high
Removable 10180 Lithium Ion Battery
Rechargeable via Micro USB
CREE XP-G2 Emitter
Bolt action pen mechanism
Waterproof LAMY M22 Refill (Fine Black)
Magnetic quick release light
Keychain Cap (OPTIONAL)
By combining two Everyday Carry items into one package, the durable Refyne P1 reduces pocket clutter while extending convenience and functionality.
Refyne, Modern Minimal Carry.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Bringing a product from the drawing board to reality is not an easy task. We’ve been fortunate enough to have the funds available to create production ready samples to make sure manufacturing runs smoothly. All that remains is to raise enough money so that we can greenlight the factory and begin production. With that said, there are always unforeseen events that can happen, especially when dealing with a factory that’s half a world away. We wouldn’t bring this to Kickstarter if we weren’t completely confident that we could get our project delivered to backers on schedule.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
