campaign.story:
Before you start reading, maybe you want to watch that video again, but this time in beautiful High Definition!  Go ahead, make it full screen and enjoy all those extra pixels.  (Kickstarter downsamples the main project video to SD quality to save a little bandwidth.)
Wait, before we tell you about the project, why don't you tell us a little about yourself.  Start with number 1, 2 or 10 below.
1: I am an Electronics Guru 
Oh, you're an Electronics Guru and want to know all the gritty details?  Then you should GOTO 30!
2: I want to know how the MegaCube + eBOSS with ID Chip = Awesome
It's true.  The MegaCube connected to an eBOSS with ID Chip is awesome.  To get right to the details on that, GOTO 45!
10: I am new to electronic wizardry. What the heck is this?
The MegaCube is a programmable, reusable, simple little computer. It allows anyone, particularly software and hardware engineers, to try out ideas, creating prototypes of their own electronic gizmos, with much less grunt work. The MegaCube can gather feedback from external sensors (detect light, motion, temperature, etc.) and control actions (turn on motors, illuminate lights, synchronize and communicate with other devices, etc.)
There is related trend on the rise called the Maker Movement. This is a culture of invention, where people (not just engineers!) use tools like the MegaCube, 3D printers, CNC machines, robots, etc. to design their own things. The MegaCube is intended to act as the brains of the "things" in the Internet of Things (IoT). Although it's in its infancy now, you'll hear more and more about the IoT in the next few years.
20: This is great and all, but what can I DO with it?
You could use a MegaCube to:
Control a robot to pick Cheetos up and hold them up for you to snack on hands free to keep the orange stuff off your fingers
Act as the brains of a remote control vehicle
Control equipment in a radio tower
Be the core controller of a build-it-yourself 3D printer
Activate motors to automatically adjust your window blinds based on current time, sunlight, outside temperature, and the temperature you want your house to be.
Make a bunch of LED lights outside your house do crazy awesome stuff during the holidays (like, say, blink to the beat of music)
The list of things you could make using a MegaCube are practically endless!
Here are some of the fun things we've already done with it:
Control a remote control car (it drove down the aisle at Mike's wedding, acting as a ring bearer, yes, really!)
Control servos to move a robot arm
Monitor a fish tank's water temperature and display it
Display cool stuff on an LCD screen
Monitor a clothes dryer and send a text when it's done
Make a "Fruit Announcer" that tells you what fruit you just touched
30: I'm an Electronics Guru - tell me more!
Mike, creator of the MegaCube, wanted to build a clone of an Arduino Mega, which is a flexible, easy to use hardware and software open source electronics development platform. He wanted to build one that...
Is able to store multiple programs simultaneously (streamlining use across projects with a unique eBOSS for each project) - GOSUB 45!
Is smaller (check out its size vs. a quarter above)
Is "Socket-able"
Allowed access to all 100 pins of the processor
Didn't require expensive proprietary connectors
Used standard 0.1" pitch spacing to make it Protoboard friendly
And, on top of all that, he wanted it to be more reasonably priced!
40: You say it's Socket-able, right?
The Embedded Break Out Shield System (eBOSS) - allows embedding the MegaCube in your own project. It has solder tabs for all 100 pins and still allows the MegaCube to be neatly unplugged and reused in other projects. Due to the 0.1" pitch spacing of the pins, you can use our eBOSS or you can also solder your own female header pins on to protoboards to socket it directly into your own project.
45: Can I move the MegaCube between projects without reprogramming it?
Yes, you can!  The eBOSS has been redesigned to include a Unique ID chip which has a hard coded 64-bit registration number and 48-bit node address.  There are also programmable bits so you can add your own personal ID/data.  So why is this important?  Having a unique ID allows you to have multiple programs (sketches) stored on the MegaCube at once and, when moving it between eBOSSes, the MegaCube runs the appropriate program based on ID.
You can move your MegaCube between the eBOSS mounted in your Larson scanner LED project for your Knight Rider Car Club and the eBOSS soldered to your Battlestar Galactica Cylon helmet without having to stop at your computer to reprogram the MegaCube.  When you add another project, just add another program to the MegaCube and plug it into another inexpensive eBOSS.  Our API makes it easy and only using 1-wire communication means that it doesn't use up an SPI port or UART.
It's not our problem if KITT gets mad when you move your MegaCube over to the Cylon.
50: Neat! I want one. Is it for me?
The MegaCube is an affordable and enhanced electronics prototyping platform intended for the intermediate to pro user who is looking for more than what the Arduino Mega offers in a package that is smaller than an UNO and is easily embedded in a project at a lower cost than the Arduino Mega or its clone offerings. For anyone interested in getting into the Maker Movement and Arduino world, the MegaCube along with the BOSS and an FTDI cable (to connect directly to your computer's USB port) or ICSP programmer is all that you would need to get started.
60: Nice. How can I keep it safe during testing?
The MegaCube Holder is made of ABS and protects the MegaCube from touching conductive surfaces during your development process. Mike decided it might be an important addition when he fried one by absentmindedly setting it on his aluminum laptop. Now if he can just get rid of the burn marks on his laptop...
70: I want a MegaCube and a shield!
Excellent! Check out our Combos for a MegaCube or, if you want it all, go for our Ultimate Combo, which has the MegaCube, eBOSS and Holder.
80: I'm in! I want it before everyone else.
We have a limited supply of Early Adopter MegaCubes and Starter Combos, so be quick about it! Not only is the price slashed, you get the honor of calling yourself an Early Adopter, and who doesn't want such a noble title? Seriously, we'll post on Facebook or something about how tech-forward you are.
90: This is so cool, I wish my name was on it!
You are in luck. Become one of our Sponsors and your name will appear on the eBOSS or the MegaCube itself. Seriously, you back us as a Sponsor and your name will be on every single MegaCube (or every single eBOSS) that we produce for this Kickstarter Campaign. You will be immortalized! Just imagine if one of these somehow makes it to space. Then your name will be in space! (We make no guarantees about your name making it to space.)
Seriously, though, we can only fit so many names in the limited open area on the hardware, so claim your space today before it's all gone! You can blame Mike if we run out of this reward because he was just too darned efficient with his designs.
100: Is everything going to look like it does in the photos?
Although the early prototypes are green, the final MegaCube will use blue text and graphics on white circuit boards just like the eBOSS pictures. Trust us. It will look totally sexy, especially when you're holding it in your hand.
110: I want more details on this sweet tech!
Glad to hear it! Check out all the juicy bits on our website at http://megadom.net.
120: No, seriously, show me its innards!
Our MegaCube Pinout Diagram should shed some light on it for you:
Oh, you like to use Fritzing?  We've got you covered with the MegaCube Fritzing Part:
130: Rewards
Here's a nice visual version, but for all the details and to actually choose a reward, check out the rewards listed in the right column (you'll have to scroll up a ways!) 
The Rewards!
140: Who are you guys, again?
The short version is that Mike, the creator of the MegaCube, started up his own company, DomCo Electronics Inc., an electrical engineering consultancy, and initially developed the MegaCube under that company, which is why you see that name and company web address on some of his MegaCube prototypes. He got together with The Jo(h)ns and we formed MEGADOM Electronics Inc. as a small company specifically to bring Mike's prototypes to market so that all engineers can get their hands on them. Of course, we're a new company and we need your backing (see below) to get us rocking, so thank you in advance! Check out our Full Bio to learn more about each of us.
150: Why do you need our help?
We're here on Kickstarter because we need your help to take the MegaCube from prototype to production. We've gotten pretty far on our own, but now we need your financial backing to go the rest of the way. We'll use the Kickstarter funds to buy parts in bulk quantities, set up our assembly process, and ship the MegaCubes and eBOSSes to you as quickly as possible.
Your support will go a long way to help us get our company off the ground (and into the hands of our customers!) We think the most exciting thing about creating this product is seeing all of the awesome things that you guys find to do with it!
160: How did you figure out the funding goal?
Mike has a ton of experience in building electronic devices for his career, so he used all the knowledge to determine the start up costs involved in putting together all the bits and pieces necessary to build the MegaCube in mass quantities. Our ultimate costs will depend on how many of each unit we have to produce, and we determined the minimums we need to get reasonable pricing from manufacturers. Check out our Risks and Challenges below for more information.
170: I want a combo that you don't offer.
No problem! Send us a message and we'll see what we can do. We'll either create another reward that meets your criteria (within the limits of KickStarter's rules, of course) or ask you to pick a similar reward and include the appropriate additional amount.
180: This seems mighty familiar...
Yes, we launched a nearly identical KickStarter campaign in 2014, with a much higher funding goal, because we wanted to minimize our costs (manufacturers provide big price breaks at higher quantities).  We relaunched this KickStarter with a much more modest goal, with a much smaller income margin because we believe that the MegaCube needs to get into your hands.  Just getting the MegaCube out there will help slingshot us into the next phase of our production plan - we're just starting out smaller this time!
200. What the heck are all those numbers before the headings?
What, you mean, like the 200 in front of this one?  That's a throwback to old programming languages like BASIC, just for fun.  And yeah, we skipped 190 because you didn't have to use every number in BASIC code, either.  See, Microsoft isn't the only one who can skip numbers.
210. Timeline
Copyright Information
Knight Rider is property NBC & Universal Television, with whom we are not affiliated.  On the other hand, if you used MegaCubes in a K.I.T.T. replica, that would be sweet!  Battlestar Galactica's Cylons are property of Universal Pictures.  Same story there.  No relation, but if you build some Cylons with MegaCubes, please send us some pictures and video!  K.I.T.T. and the Cylon are only used as comedic, low resolution images for fun.  We cite Wikipedia's page in hopes that the concepts there also allow us to use such images.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Versatility

The MegaCube needs to have the right footprint and flexibility to allow it to be easily used with other devices. Mike is already on top of that by...

1. Making certain that every single pin on the MegaCube is broken out, available for use and not blocked by any other components

2. Designing the MegaCube to be “protoboard friendly” to allow for effortless prototyping

3. Creating the inexpensive eBOSS as a perfect companion to the MegaCube to allow developers to use their MegaCube in multiple projects without needing to solder and unsolder it repeatedly

Construction Quality

Electronic products like this require precision manufacturing techniques, including using high quality solder stencils to produce superb connections between components and circuit boards. We've partnered with respected Contract Manufacturing (CM) firms and we have full oversight of the entire process to make sure the job is done right!

Experience

One risk for many electronics projects like ours is that the project members just don’t have the experience they need to get the products properly designed and manufactured.

Mike has been designing electronics for decades. He has worked with countless manufacturers to get his designs turned into real devices, so getting the MegaCube manufactured will be, as they say, a piece of cake!

Delivery of Hardware Rewards

As with every piece of hardware, the delivery depends on one or multiple production partners. We planned everything thoroughly but in the unlikely event that something goes wrong, you'll hear from us.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Two Thirds, Here We Come!
During your Memorial Day BBQ (or other fun weekend activity you're doing elsewhere in the world), be sure to mention that you backed a Kickstarter project that you're sure is going to fund and then explain how you'll be building robots and 3D printers in no time and everyone else should get MegaCubes, too!

campaign.story:
For the italian readers: pronto il sito in italiano http://yooquik.com
Yooquik is the new open source wireless security system. It is based on an ARM microcontroller that manage a three axis accelerometer and a three axis magnetometer. The bluetooth connectivity allow your tablet/smartphone to become a brain for your home security alarm. 
A simple philosophy behind Yooquik project: make a simple and secure device for the home/office security. The end user can install it by himself and manage via a cloud connected smartphone or tablet, whereas the maker can customize it using his Arduino knowledge and his Javascript skill. Open Source is the magic key to this project!
Hi, I’m Marcello Gesmundo, the Yooquik creator. I’m an electronic engineer and I designed the Yooquik hardware and software to make sure that each user can use it in the most intuitive way. Some years ago I was on vacation and I had a problem with my old home alarm system: that was the moment when I decided to create a new security system that would allow me to be sure about what was happening at my home. Why yet another new one? Because the existing ones could not be customized or integrated with other devices or other personal projects. It had to be based on a simple gateway alarm where the software only could determine its functionality. It had to be Open Source! Why not using the iPad you used before buying the new one? Why not using Apple HomeKit today? Because it’s not open, you can’t customize it and you can’t connect to anything else you need!
On February 2014 with my friends from Acme Systems I presented at Nuremberg Embedded World fair the first Yooquik developer board for the automation purpose. But I wanted more: an entire security system without a mainboard! At the end of 2014 I designed the new bluetooth Yooquik device assembled at early 2015 and today I start this campaign to begin a large production for the end users and the makers! I need your help to create a large community of makers and developers to expand this vision.
Yooquik project is dedicated to my wife Antonella and my children Davide and Valentina. It's not so easy to share life with a husband or a father that works about 17 hours at day: I'm grateful for their patience.
Many thanks to all backers for considering my project: I really appreciate any support they can provide. My sincere gratitude to Carlo (Progetti & Sistemi) who followed the project evolution from the beginning, becoming an enthusiastic supporter together its partners Franco and Gianvito.
Thank you so much to my friends Sergio, Roberto and Ennio (Acme Systems) for their support in the prototypes making and, last but not least, a special thanks to my best and loyal friend Pier Luigi, my mentor and new partner in this awesome adventure.
Here is Yooquik
You need just few steps to turn your tablet/smartphone into a true security system.
Go on App Store or Google Play and download the free App Yooquik
Play it and create your personal account on Yooquik Cloud
Insert the battery into your Yooquik devices
Place your devices on windows and doors
DONE! Your security system is now ready!
All windows, doors and blinds opening detection. Forget the traditional magnetic opening reed sensors and pulse counters for blinds: Yooquik has a true three axis magnetometer that reads the magnetic field. All kinds of frame can be managed. It's impossible to deceive it using an external magnet because the magnetic field would change and Yooquik would send an alarm notification.
Vibration detector. None traditional tilt sensor (inertial sensor): a true three axis accelerometer measure the vibration of the frame and analyze it to avoid wrong alarms recognition.
Temperature sensor. Keep under control the temperature next to the doors and windows and track a map of the trending of the temperature.
Microcontroller Not the usual passive sensor: an ARM microcontroller analyze the magnetometer, accelerometer and temperature sensors data with a very low power consumption. A single battery can grant from 18 to 24 month of functionality.
Bluetooth connectivity. Avoid a dedicated 866MHz radio gateway: with the Bluetooth Smart radio all devices are connected to your tablet/smartphone without other devices.
Plug and play installation. No specialized installers needed: remove the plastic film behind the sensor and place it where you need. Done!
Easy configuration. No need to configure your router in order to access from the outside: use your Yooquik Cloud account to manage your security system wherever you are.
Push notifications. Receive notifications on your smartphone about all events. Choose which events you need to monitor and who will receive the relevant notifications.
Open Source and Arduino compatible. Connect your device to your Mac or PC using the connector inside it; use the well known Arduino software to create your own personal device. Do you want to transform your device in an iBeacon hot spot? You can! Upload your software into your Yooquik device and go live!
Personalization. You can personalize your security system device as well as you usually do with your smartphone cover. You can also create your own top cover: download our base model and customize it as you want with your 3D printer.
Expandable. The Yooquik connector is pin-to-pin compatible with the Acme Systems boards: connect your sensor to your Acme board and make your awesome device!
Free App for iOS and Android. Manage your security system with the free iOS or Android App. Create multiple users with different permission levels.
IP Cameras. Connect to your cameras directly from within the App and look for help to configure your cameras using the community. Your video stream is managed by our Yooquik Cloud and encoded to be available from all HTML5 capable device. Earn points by posting the configurations of your cameras and get discounts on our Yooquik store.
Telegram. Use our bot or create yours to manage your security system within the Telegram App. Chat with your security system!
Installation example
Install a sensor on every door and window of your home/office and put your tablet or smartphone in a safe location as central as possible. You can also use one or more sensor to protect your bungalow when you are on vacation.
Prototypes
What's the first step to create a new product after the idea? A lot of evaluation boards! And what's the second one? More prototypes! Take a look at last pre-production Yooquik device.
PLAY

 Under the hood
Have a look inside Yooquik device.
PLAY

 Specifications
16MHz ARM Cortex-M0 CPU
128kb Flash
8kb Ram
2.4 GHz Band Bluetooth® Smart
Built-In Chip Antenna
3 magnetic field channels and 3 acceleration channels
±2/±4/±8/±12 gauss magnetic full scale
±2/±4/±6/±8/±16 g linear acceleration full scale
16-bit data output
White LED
CR2477 Lithium Manganese Dioxide coin button battery
18/24 months battery life
Connector with I2C, Serial, GPIO
Arduino® compatible
Range: about 30m max
Dimensions (max): 55mm x 55mm x 17mm 
Note: some specification can slightly change on production series.
Rewards
Timeline
Who works on an open source project has many way to develop it in front of him: announcing his own idea at the beginning, or donating it at a comunity after having made a product. I am in the middle: for a few years I got ahead the idea of yooquick trying various technical solutions without the support of a comunity. Now, after having written base code to verify that the idea was practicable and that the hardware worked as predicted, I decided to start this campaign, so I chose one of the possible way. I could have waited to complete the firmware, the app and the software on the server side, as well as the documentation. As regard all the Node JS modules I published on GitHub the choice was always the same (github.com/mgesmundo). But the compare with other people always helps so the reasoning was easy: as the hardware is ready and perfectly working, why not to make it available now and complete in a second time what the end user needs with the help of other people with whom share and improve the ideas? That's all!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In a project that involves both hardware and software the main problem is the hardware. Working closely with the manufacturer Acme Systems hardware prototypes have resulted immediately working and can be certified. I will perfect the CAD files to launch the injection molds of the plastic enclosure. The second challenge is the software. Yooquik software includes the firmware on the device (Arduino), the App for iOS and Android (Cordova) and the server side software (NodeJS). This is the main area where I hope in a contribute by the developers community. As developer contributor I published some NodeJS modules on NPM repository used for the Yooquik software and for the Acme Systems boards. I'm a true perfectionist, that's why I publish only when all tests are done, the software coverage is satisfying and the documentation is completed. A lot of time to do that but I love this!
If many other developers join this project, it will grow quickly.
I will keep in touch with you for each step I take to keep you upraised of Yooquik project progress status according the above timeline.

Yooquik® is a registered trademark of Yoovant® by Marcello Gesmundo.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

comments.content: I wish you all the best on your next project.
Ah well, cancelled project. What are your plans for the future of Yooquik?

@Creator - have you given up? So why do you not cancel this campaign? If you don't want to overthink your product, strategy and pricing this campaign never would be successful. Sorry, but I like your Idea, but how you try to realize, it can't work.
http://tinyurl.com/AudioShield

This is no Onlineshop and we don't get instant an ready product, so no one is willing to pay for it like this. I think 15€ for OEM device or Programmer and 29€ for ready and complete product is an realistic price we would pay and 6€ is an realistic price for shipping of this tiny device with registered postage. With this prices and more discount for wholesale backers you should get easy over 300.000€ and get a really big base of backers that spread the word and help bringing your product successful into market where you can make money. Kickstarter is not for making money, it's for bringing products to life and into market. If you don't understand you should realize that this campaign only cost you lifetime and you and your product won't be successful.
Thank you and greetings from Germany!

campaign.story:
Update (June 2nd/2016):
The project page with Arduino code samples is here:  http://www.engineeringshock.com/beast-display-manual.html   The code sample builds on the previous code sample.  The code samples found at the above project page were used in the below video manual.  
Update (May 30th/2016):
Hi everyone! The video manual is now available, and Arduino code samples will be published tomorrow.  Stay tuned!  This video features some Arduino controlled projects, so please have a gander if you have time!
Hi Everyone!
Thank you for taking an interest in my 17th Kickstarter campaign!  My name is Patrick Mitchell, and I want to introduce you to "The Beast Display"!  The Beast Display Kickstarter campaign is very much a DIY/Maker based Kickstarter campaign, as all but one reward tier requires some form of assembly.
The Beast Display set has four modes of operation:
Up Count:  By using either the buttons connected to the main processor board, or your Arduino Uno, you can program in a final score anywhere between 0001 to 9999.  Every time the relative button is pressed, or signal line is pulsed to (Arduino control), the display increments!  Once the score has been hit, the Beast Display signals a victory scroll!  A GPIO on the processor board toggles states when this happens, so that you can control a relay, or an external circuit once the score is hit. You an also reset at any time using either the buttons, or with Arduino.  
Down Count:  By using either the buttons connected to the main processor board, or your Arduino Uno, you can program in a starting value anywhere between 0001 to 9999. Every time the relative button is pressed, or signal line is pulsed to (Arduino control), the display decrements! Once the display has been decremented down to "0000", the Beast Display signals a victory scroll!  A GPIO on the processor board toggles states when this happens, so that you can control a relay, or an external circuit once the score reaches 0000.  You an also reset at any time using either the buttons, or with Arduino.
Countdown Timer Mode:  This is your standard countdown timer function.  Easily program in a starting time (anywhere from 0001 to 99:59, and the countdown begins!  As with all modes, you can reset at any time using either the buttons, or with your Arduino Uno.  Once the timer reaches "0000", all segments display the victory scroll, and a GPIO on the processor board toggles states when this happens, so that you can control a relay, or an external circuit.
Score Keeping Mode: The left two digits of the display are reserved for one team, while the left two digits are reserved for the second team! Press the right button (red) to increment the score on the two right digits, and the left button (green) to increment the score on the left two digits.  You can reset at any time by pressing and holding both buttons at the same time.  If either score reaches 99, then the score will flash, and the unit will take for the user to reset the unit.
Applications:
1) You can include the Beast Display with your Arduino projects.  
2) It can be used as a score keeper at sporting events.  
3) It can be interfaced with a target practice system.
4) It can be used in entertainment centre projects, escape room scenarios, or as a game timer in indoor paintball or airsoft arenas.  
5) With four modes of operation, and with the Arduino compatibility option, the possibilities are endless!  We provide the electronics, and you make it your own!  Not sure if your application is possible?  Send us your questions, and we'll get back to you promptly!
Arduino Compatible?  Yup!
There is a connector on the main processor board that allows for you to interface with your Arduino.  
The GAME OVER pin:  There is a GPIO pin set as an output that toggles states when time runs out in countdown timer mode, when a count up/down limit has been hit, and when a score hits 99 in score keeping mode.  With this, you can control a relay, or simply to tell your Arduino that a goal has been hit, or that a game is over.  
The Master Reset - This pin acts as a master reset that can be controlled by Arduino.  Use any Arduino GPIO to manually reset the Beast display by applying a 5v pulse for 500ms or more, and then clear the line to reset the Beast display with Arduino. 
Button Controls - There are two GPIO pins that are on the same control lines as the two LED buttons.  You can use your Arduino to act as the buttons would.  Simply pulse 5v to either of these two lines for 100ms or more, and then clear it to simulate a button press.  
A comprehensive video manual will be provided later on in the campaign, and code samples will be available to pledges!
For DIY'er & Makers:
This campaign is very much DIY oriented.  Some rewards come with nothing assembled, while others comes with assembled and tested processor boards.  Every reward tier that includes the large displays, (minus the most expensive tier) requires that the user wire up the large displays to the main board, and solder the LED buttons to the connector cable.  This below video outlines the process of assembling and testing the electronics from scratch:
The Comprehensive Assembly Video:
The Casing & The Casing Assembly Manual:
Only the upper reward tiers include pre-cut wood, or fully built Beast Displays installed in stained wood casings.  My lively wife is the designer of the casing, and she will be providing a casing assembly manual in PDF form for those of you who pledge towards a reward tier with pre-cut wood.  This PDF will be available nearing the end of this campaign.  For those of you who pledge towards a reward that does not include pre-cut wood, or a fully assembled Beast Display, we encourage you to build your own displays, and share pictures of your own work to be published on the upcoming Beast Display Project Page at www.engineeringshock.com.
Reward Shipments:
It is expected that all rewards will be shipped by the first to second week in July.  For those of you pledging towards reward tiers that do not include pre-cut wood, or a fully assembled Beast Display, you can expect your reward to be shipped by the third week of June at the latest.  Rewards that include pre-cut wood, or fully assembled beast displays should be shipped by The second week of July at the latest.
Do you want to pledge towards something very specific?  Drop me a line and tell me about it.  I'll see about making you your very own reward tier!   
Introducing The Electronics:
The main processor board takes care of it all!  Thsi board interfaces with the two LED buttons via cables, the 4x displays, and a voltage booster module for display light level adjustment.  It holds all of the programming, and acts to drive the displays as well.
The voltage booster module is a necessity here.  It allows for the user to adjust the light level of the displays. This booster pshould be calibrated to 16v - 18v for optimal display brightness.
The LARGE Displays that are included in some reward tiers are just under 5 1/2" high, and just over 4" wide.  They are common anode displays, and when four of them are placed side by side, they look AMAZING!
Magnet wire (also called enamelled wire) is what we use for wiring the displays together, and to the main processor board.  This wire looks like uninsulated copper wire, but it isn't.  This wire is covered in an enamel that acts as an insulation.  It can be burned off, or scratched off, or both.  This wire is talked about in detail in the assembly video.  It is easy to use.  you can use wire-wrap wire if you'd like, but magnet wire is just as easy to use, and any reward tier that includes the large displays will also come with a whack of this stuff! 
The 120-240VAC IN (50-60Hz) // 9v 1A OUT AC-DC Wall Adapter is American and European wall outlet power supply friendly. However, if you are in Europe, you'll need an adapter to plug this into your wall. This AC-DC adapter provides nominal power to your fully assembled Beast display! 
The LED buttons (Red & Green) are used for incrementing, decrementing, resetting, programming in values, selecting modes, etc.  They comes with connector cables that are to be soldered together using the instructions in the assembly video.
The Arduino connector cable gives you the option to interface with your Arduino (Or any TTL compatible platform). Every reward tier (minus he momento reward tier) will include one of these.
What is left to do?
The hardware is production ready, and the software is nearly complete.  I simply need to optimize the software so that it is perfect!  I will also be adding to the software, and making a video or two showing my progress during this campaign.  I also need to make a compressive video manual, Arduino code samples, and a wood casing assembly PDF manual (care of my lovely wife).  All of this will be completed and shared by the end of this campaign.
Why Kickstarter?
Kickstarter and the Kickstarter community have helped me to bring fifteen of my ideas to life thus far.  If not for you, I'd be building my projects on prototyping boards, and putting them on the bookshelf in my lab.  Hundreds and hundreds of people have pledged towards my projects, and I'm extremely grateful.  I've been working with the Kickstarter community for over two years now, and I hope to be creating projects and working with you all for many years to come!  Thank you all for taking an interest in my projects!
Production Schedule:
During the first week of this campaign, I'll be working on tweaking the software, and working compiling the information needed to make my parts orders. I will share my progress at least twice a week via project updates.
I'll be placing orders for PCBs, components, displays, and accessories two weeks after this project is launched.  After two weeks, I should be able to properly forecast what will be required to fulfil reward shipments. 
During the third week of this campaign, I will be finalizing the software, and I'll begin working on the video manual.  At this time, my wife will begin work on the assembly PDF for the wooden case.  As soon as both of these videos are completed, I will publish the links in a project update.
By the fourth week of this campaign, all components, accessories, and assemblies should be in transit to my home.  I expect to have all of the relative hardware in house by the end of this campaign.
The first two weeks following the end of this campaign will be dedicated to quality control, reward packaging and shipping.  Rewards that include electronics only (No pre-cut wood/fully assembled Beast displays) are expected to ship by the end of the second week following the end of this campaign.  This falls on the first/second week of July, depending on the exact date that this campaign is launched. Reward shipments that include pre-cut wood are expected to ship shortly after (around mid to late July). The same goes for fully assembled Beast display units in stained wooden boxes.
Final Notes:
If you haven't pledged towards one of my campaigns in the past, then I wish to convey to you that I take my campaigns very seriously.  Communication is very important, and it isn't uncommon to see more than 15x project updates.  I have always managed to ship rewards on time, or early.  Delays can happen, but they have not happened to me yet.  I believe in running my campaigns with the utmost integrity.  If you h ave any questions or concerns, drop me a line.  I'm more than happy to speak with you one-on-one.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are very few risks involved with this campaign. I've successfully completed reward shipments on time for all fifteen of my successful campaigns. I have solid relationships with my component suppliers, and with my PCB manufacturer. If by chance this campaign were to blow up, the only reward shipments that might be slightly delayed would be rewards that included pre-cut wood/fully assembled beast displays, as she will be doing all of this on her own, with limited help from myself. This is very unlikely. If you've pledged towards one of my previous campaigns, you'll know that I always do my best to ship rewards on time, or even early. My last four campaigns had all rewards shipped early! If you have any concerns at all, please do not hesitate to send me a message!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Introducing Modkit.io
We failed to reach our pre-goal of 1000 backers so this campaign is over but our work is still just beginning.  Please read our final update or visit Modkit.io to learn more.
Modkit.io is an Event Oriented Multithreaded Programming Language
Modkit.io is a new kind of programming language for the Internet of Everything for Everyone. It has a rich, yet surprisingly intuitive, multithreaded and event oriented syntax that will be familiar to millions of young students and educators who have been exposed to Scratch. And it works with Wiring, the microcontroller framework used in the Arduino IDE as well as development tools from TI, Particle, and Intel.  
Multithreading is traditionally thought of and introduced as an advanced programming concept, but it just means you can have multiple things going on at the same time. Event-oriented simply means things can alert other things when something interesting happens. Unlike most programming languages, both of these concepts are built-in to Modkit.io, not introduced as a complicated afterthought.
Supported Editors and Hardware
Modkit.io works with the most popular programming environments
Modkit.io works with the most popular microcontroller development environments including the Arduino IDE, Particle Build, TI Energia, and Wiring.  If your hardware is supported by one of these environments chances are you can use Modkit.io to program it and make use of all of your existing libraries! The boards in the image below have already been tested.
Modkit.io supports the most popular development boards
But we could never test the 100's of possible boards ourselves. Be one of our first 1000 $1 backers by June 1, and help us test Modkit.io for your favorite development hardware.
Help us test Modkit.io with even more boards by pledging just $1
Pre-campaign
Important: We will add additional rewards once we reach our goal of 1000 pre-campaign supporters. But if we fail to reach our pre-campaign goal by June 1, our campaign will be cancelled due to insignificant demand.
Unlike most Kickstarter campaigns that start giving out rewards months (sometimes years) after funding success and add additional "stretch-goals" once they reach their initial fundraising goal, like most everything else at Modkit, we thought we'd do things a bit differently. So instead of a stretch-goal we set a pre-goal that's actually not about money at all. Our goal is to get our new programming language Modkit.io out to 1000 backers before we even start our campaign!
Our official campaign starts on June 1, but to connect with our earliest adopters and potential partners, get important feedback, and gather stories about how you will use Modkit.io, we're offering 1000 backers a single download of our Modkit.io library for Wiring-based microcontrollers for the absolute minimum Kickstarter pledge of $1. If we don't reach our pre-goal by June 1, we plan to cancel our campaign and if we don't reach our final goal by June 30, none of our backers will be charged. So if we're not successful you will actually get your pre-reward for free!
What do we mean by Internet?
The Internet starts with local networks
When people think about the Internet they often think about being able to communicate with anyone and everyone, anywhere in the world. But the Internet is simply a network of networks and it all starts with local networks. The same Internet protocols that allow you to communicate with a website or service across the world, allow you to send a document to a printer or to stream content to a television across the room. These same protocols can even be used to communicate between different programs on a single computer or device. This makes the Internet both technologically and socially democratic.
What do we mean by Everything?
The Internet of Everything starts with Things
Just like the Internet starts locally, we believe that the Internet of Everything should begin with a single thing and scale up from there. When developing programming languages to talk to things across the world, it is interesting to think that the same languages people use to talk to each other are the very languages we use to formulate thoughts, make personal plans, and ultimately to talk to oneself. 
We've seen many tools and languages proposed for the Internet of Things that do not provide a way for things to talk to themselves and to other things across the room in the same way that they talk to other things or computers across the world. Modkit.io was designed to democratize and bring the true essence of the Internet to Everything.  Our preview Modkit.io library for Wiring is focused on the most local network of things, the individual components connected to a single circuit board, and helping them communicate with each other more fluently than ever before.
Who do we mean by Everyone?
Inspired by Scratch for beginners - Multithreaded and Event-driven for everyone
Most text-based programming languages and other serious tools for technology creation are designed for engineers or computer scientists. With over 40 combined years of research and development in STEM education programs, Fab Labs and graphical programming languages such as Scratch and Modkit for VEX, we took a completely different approach and designed Modkit.io for Everyone. Just as text editors like Microsoft Word and Open Office are used everywhere from elementary school to grad school and by everyone from amateur lyricists to professional lawyers, we do not believe well designed tools have to appeal to only one audience or use case. We have seen graduate students at MIT struggle learning programming languages and young students from low-income neighborhoods excel at the same. This unique and broad exposure has led us to see far more commonalities than differences across novice and experienced programmers and it inspired and enabled us to design a programming language truly accessible to Everyone.
Related Languages
Modkit.io comes from a large family tree
Modkit.io is influenced by a large family tree and has benefitted from extensive interaction between its designer Ed Baafi and the designers of some of the most popular languages used by hobbyists and in education. For Ed it started over a decade ago, when Amon crossed the same bridge you see in our video carrying a flash drive containing Scratch, a new graphical programming language from his advisor Mitch Resnick's Lifelong Kindergarten Group at the MIT Media Lab. Ed had experience teaching with Logo, one of Scratch's text-based predecessors, alongside one of its original designers Dr. Cynthia Solomon. Amon said that like Logo, Scratch was designed to make coding more accessible for kids and that just like hip-hop DJs would remix beats, vocals, and samples from existing material, Scratch was designed to let kids remix sounds, images and the programs that control them into whole new digital creations.
History
We founded Modkit to bring the same accessibility as Scratch to microcontroller programming, originally targeting Arduino compatible development boards powered by the C++ based Wiring framework which itself has its own rich history. But Wiring/Arduino was single threaded, forcing programmers to coordinate everything in a single event loop and Modkit's early tools suffered this same limitation. If Scratch allows kids to remix like an experienced DJ with a set of turntables and a multitrack recorder, trying to remix with a single thread of control is like trying to mix with a single turntable and only one track. It's not impossible but you need a live band and you need to tightly coordinate everything. If you want to make any changes you usually have to redo the whole song. It wasn't until Modkit partnered with VEX Robotics to create Modkit for VEX, that we finally had the opportunity to bring a new language into the world. Originally called Wiring++ to honor Wiring's creator Hernando Barragán, Modkit.io has been in heavy development ever since and sits behind Modkit for VEX's powerful graphical programming blocks.
Future
Unlike many Kickstarter campaigns that are complete when they produce a film, gadget, or electronic hardware and ship rewards to their backers, for Modkit.io our Kickstarter campaign is just the beginning. Once a physical item is shipped there is not much left to do but we understand that the nature of software is that it is never complete. This is why we are offering $1 rewards even before we start our campaign, but it is the same reason we need a critical mass of supporters and partners if we are to build a community around the Modkit.io language and meet that community's needs well into the future. We will update you about our plans for the future once we have reached our pre-goal, but if we fail to reach 1000 backers for $1 by June 1, we are afraid there may be no future for Modkit.io at all.


Rewards
1000 Early Adopters get a single download of our Modkit.io Wiring library for Particle, TI Energia, and Arduino
While Modkit.io is a programming language for Everything and Everyone, our pre-rewards are designed just for Early Adopters and Early Evangelists. Both rewards feature a preview release of the Modkit.io library that brings the Modkit.io language to popular Wiring-based editors such as the Arduino IDE, Particle Build and TI Energia. Early Adopters get a single download of the Modkit.io library for just $1 even before our Kickstarter campaign has actually begun. We believe that once you try our simple event driven multithreaded programming, and after we open up additional rewards, you'll want to increase your pledge so that you can continue to follow our development and make room for another early adopter to try it out.
100 Early Evangelists get a Modkit flash drive to help spread the Modkit.io language and show support
Early Evangelists receive a limited edition Modkit flash drive that will only ship if our campaign is successful. Use it to share the Modkit.io updates you'll receive for one year from our funding completion. We know that many of our potential supporters are educators or members of local Makerspaces and Fab Labs so this is a great way to pass Modkit.io along to others. While it is too early to decide how we will license Modkit.io, the preview will be released under a special license that allows you to share it with your colleagues, friends, classmates and students. Help us spread the word and we'll be sure to add some more reward tiers as these begin to fill up.
Modkit Team
The core Modkit team met while designing and running the first of over one thousand worldwide Fab Labs as well as a one-of-a-kind youth maker program called Learn2Teach, Teach2Learn. In alphabetical order we are:

Ed Baafi is the lead instigator and founder of Modkit and the designer of the Modkit.io language. In 2011 he dropped out of the MIT Media Lab to focus on Modkit and hasn't looked back. From time to time he gets a chance to write including a chapter on hardware and software standards in Building Open Source Hardware. 

Dr. Susan Klimczak is a self-proclaimed education geek who loves integrating art and technology in youth programs across Boston. She received a doctorate in education from Harvard University focusing on informal educational environments.  She is also a fellow in the FabLearn Fellows Program at Stanford University. 

Dr. Amon Millner is Assistant Professor of Computing and Innovation at Olin College of Engineering.  While studying for his PhD with the Lifelong Kindergarten Group at the MIT Media Lab, he helped design Scratch and related technologies. He is immortalized as a character in Scratch so you can program him to do your bidding.  

Collin Reisdorf is the designer who focuses on the user interfaces and experience for Modkit's graphical programming tools.  He taught himself programming while studying design at MassArt and has designed experiences for some of the world's most recognizable brands before Ed convinced him to join Modkit.


Credits
Modkit.io was designed and developed by Ed Baafi with support from VEX Robotics and inspired and adapted from Scratch from the Lifelong Kindergarten Group at the MIT Media Lab.

"Modkit.io - the Most Important Technology" stars Ismael and Sang, directed by Michael King and co-produced by Ed Baafi and Michael King. Music by Garrett Rose as an original interpretation of Watermelon Man by Herbie Hancock. Graphics, illustrations and type layout by Collin Reisdorf.

Special thanks to Melvin H. King, Amon Millner, Susan Klimzcak, Collin Reisdorf, David Cavallo, Arnan "Roger" Sipitakiat, Cynthia Solomon, Bakhtiar Mikhak, Mitch Resnick, Leah Buechley, John Maloney,  Hernando Barragán, Daniel Ozick, Paul Copioli and Bob Mimlitch.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The preview release of Modkit.io is already complete and we're offering a limited number of single $1 downloads before our campaign has even begun, so there is very little risk that our backers will not get a clear picture of what we have already developed or receive their copies of it. We also already have the flash drives in hand which is currently our only physical reward. The biggest risk is for our company and for the future development of Modkit.io which cannot continue without significant support.

Large companies like Apple, Microsoft, and Google have historically been the only players who have built successful businesses around programming languages and we are aware that there are not many established paths for us to follow. But we are not deterred. We believe that the current state of hobbyist programming languages and tools is so far behind and so badly fragmented that educators, students, makers, hardware manufacturers, media outlets and other interested parties will get behind our efforts to change this and create a viable business around the Modkit.io language and tools. But if you've read this far, we're sure you're already ready to support us. If so, thank you! We couldn't and wouldn't do this without you.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey Modkit Friends and Family!

campaign.story:
Did you miss the RPIKit on KickStarter?  Find the RpiKit here...  
 www.DuinoKit.com  
PRiKit is Powered by the Raspberry Pi (https://www.raspberrypi.org/) microcomputer.  This kit was developed to help teach how to add components and program the Raspberry Pi microcomputer.  Learn how to use your Raspberry Pi for home automation, robotics, IoT (Internet of Things) and many other applications.
What is a Raspberry Pi you ask....  
Watch this explainer video form the Raspberry Pi Foundation.
What is the Raspberry Pi?  (Less than 2 minutes and much more entertaining than my video.)
How the RPiKit came into being.
While developing the prototyping system for the Arduino, I had many conversations with individuals looking to learn how the Raspberry Pi could be utilized and help learn electronics using Python and Java as a programming language.  Most of my conversations ended up with the differences micro-controllers and micro-computers.  After a couple years of thought and development, we have merged the two ideas.  Yes, now you will know what to do with those bizarre "pins" on the corner of the Raspberry Pi.  Believe it or not, The Raspberry Pi is much more than a Bit Coin miner or a MineCraft server.
RPiKit with Included Accessories
We have partnered with a parts kit supplier and turned this into a circuit board based "plug and play" kit without soldering, to help make learning easier and more accessible to users.  All the components will also be available separately if you want to solder together a project and build it outside the RPi prototyping kit.
Our standard RPiKit will include a 7" Andriod table that will be connected as a wireless display.  You can also use your existing device (Tablet, iPad or WiFi computer) as a display if you wish or utilize the HDMI connection for a wired display for programming and testing.  One of our Pledge levels offers the PRiKit without the wireless display.
At this stage of development, we mainly have tutorials on how to attach and actually use components in programs.  We will be hosting additional examples and projects on our "Show and Tell" forum where you can share projects and get ideas from the community.  We will show you how to attach and code for every components and module in the RPI Kit.  You will be able to take these ideas and work them into your own personal projects and inventions.
Parts and components for the RPIKit:  Metal case, Authentic Raspberry Pi V3 microcomputer, WiFi Tablet LCD screen, RC522 RFID Module, ID Card, Special-shaped ID Card, LCD1602, PS2 Joystick Module , Ultrasonic Distance Sensor Module, Triaxial Accelerometer Sensor Module (ADXL345), DHT-11(Digital Temperature & Humidity sensor), ADC0832, Stepper Motor, Stepper Motor Driver Module (Based on ULN2003A), L9110 motor driver, DC Motor, 4*4 Matrix Keyboard, 40 pin GPIO Extension Board, 40 pin GPIO Cable, Light Sensor (Photoresistor), Analog Temperature Sensor (Thermistor), Relay, Active Buzzer, Passive Buzzer, 7-Segment Display, 4-bit 7-segment Display, LED Bar Graph Display, Dot-matrix Display, 74HC595 x2, Tilt Switch, various Switchs and buttons, RGB LED, various Resistors, 2x Potentiometer (10KΩ), various Capacitors, Various Diodes, Various Transistors, Breadboard, 150 Male to Male Jumper Wires
The RPiKit is a new project of DuinoKit.com  www.RPiKit.com
The DuinoKits (Arduino based prototyping systems) mentioned in the video are available from any of these vendors.
       *Raspberry Pi logo and name is a registered trademark for the Raspberry Pi foundation. www.RaspberryPi.org
The RPiKit project is not produced or endorsed by the Raspberry Pi Foundation.

Risks and challenges
I know there are always issues that can arise when manufacturing a product. I have our current manufactures ready to assemble and complete this project to hopefully avoid any delays or issues along the way. My main concern is the possible supply of components for timely completion. By having completed similar successful Arduino based projects through KickStarter, I feel we can complete this on time and keep backers very happy.

updates.update_userinfo: New DuinoKit Eductor with curriculum and online class.
updates.update_content:
With the recent Covid-19 "learn at home" model utilized in the past few months, we decided it was time to step up the Arduino / STEM education kit.  We were in process of developing a full curriculum, teacher guide and now a online classroom environment for Arduino based electronics and coding.  This project is now on KickStarter to see if we are on the right path.....
Now with new "Distance Learning" plans in the near future for public schools, we need resources for education, fun and hands on learning more than ever before.  Although the full resources are still in development, we have the prototypes and PCB kits ready to start a production run.

Good day and Happy Holidays!
Now that we have wrapped up our RPiKits, we wanted to make you aware of a new "tiny" thing we have been working on.  We just launched a new KickStarter campaign for the DuinoKit Tiny, an Arduino based platform running the miniature ATTiny 85 microprocessor.
You can view this new project by clicking HERE.

I'm pleased to announce that all of the pledges for this KickStarter project are FINALLY shipped.
The design has changed some from the start, but I think they are looking and working good now.  Additional RPiKits can be found on our website (www.DuinoKit.com) and coming to Amazon.com soon.
If you have not received your RPiKit or at least shipping information, please send me a message at Dan@DuinoKit.com.

We have less than 20 RPiKits in need of shipping. We have been holding out for 7" tablets and a "brilliant" idea came to mind.  I have several 10" tablets with very minor surfaces scratches in the screen.  Would anyone want an upgrade from the 7" tablet to the slightly scratched 10" tablet?  
Nearly all the remaining RPiKits yet to ship have 7" tablets, this option would get them out quicker and give me something to do with a bunch of scuffed tablets.

Just toady we sent out another 22 Raspberry Pi learning kits.  These all included the larger, heavier 10" tablet so I'm looking forward to hearing back on how well they traveled. 
These mounts take about 6 hours to 3D print and then there is a lot of hand assembly and mounting in this new production, however I feel you will be delighted in the outcome.

Looks like my recent shipment arrived without any issues. I will be having more kits  go out this week and start undertaking international backers. Hopefully the extra handling and additional miles (Kilometers for my international backers) will prove I have a good, solid build.  
I'm printing LCD mounts individually, they take about 6 hours to 3D print, but appear to be surviving the shipping.  I think we have a win here.

So, I know it has been a while since my last update.  I have been having MAJOR problems with the LCD mount breaking and suppliers for the LCD.  My solution is this....
I bought a large-scale 3D printer to make a large one piece mount for the LCD display (pictured below).  I may still ship the LCD in a separate box and this would require a simple screw-in installation for the end user.

NOTE : IN THIS VERSION SOME OF THE BUGS ARE FIXED AND THE CODE IS OPTIMIZED . DONT BUY IT IF YOU ALREADY HAVE VERSION 1 OR 2 .
Hello Electronic Makers and Arduino lovers,
have you ever thought about having a big color display to connect to your Arduino Board and show values , texts and ... on screen ?
with this Arduino Shield that we call it "VGADuino" , you can connect your Arduino board to any type of TV or Monitors that has RGB or AV Composite Port
This shield has ready to use libraries and samples that you can easily import to your Arduino IDE and start programming
The board fits on Arduino UNO board and its compatible with all arduino boards and IDEs . the only needed pins Are VCC , GND , RX , TX
The board has VGA (DB15) and AV Composite ports for TV and Monitor connection , and jumpers to select VGA/AV port and Screen size
The screen resolution is 640 x 480 VGA
It has 17 text lines and 1 text scrolling line
Each line can show up to 27 characters and the scroller line can show up to 60 characters
you can change the colors from your code and easily can show your text where ever you want on screen
the device support standard ASCII codes for english , persian and arabic fonts

campaign.story:
INTRODUCING THE DRY-ACTIVE SYSTEM
Without Dry-Active (L) and With (R) Comparison of same shirt after 40 minute bike ride
The Dry-Active Device
Why did we invent Dry-Active? 
Have you ever worn a jacket because it was raining or cold outside, only to find yourself getting wet on the inside because that same jacket causes you to sweat? Biking to work, riding on a motorcycle, working, and even snow sports are all activities that may require you to wear a jacket. But once you start moving… that same jacket keeps the elements (moisture/sweat) in. For example, one Dry-Active team member often cycles to work. Nothing serious, just a leisurely 25 minute ride. When it rains, a jacket must be worn to keep him dry. However, within minutes he is sweating on the inside with no way for this extra moisture to be drawn away from his clothes.  In fact, high humidity makes you sweat even more.
What about when you’re wearing a jacket on the mountain but decide to hike up with your snowboard to ride some fresh POW. You begin to sweat, your clothes get wet, and when you’re sitting on the chairlift, you feel colder because of the added dampness.
Whether it is during work or play, keeping you dry on the inside of your jacket, leads to more comfort, drier clothes, less odour and a better regulated body temperature that keeps you healthy!
THE WORLD'S FIRST WEARABLE DEHUMIDIFIER 
Dry-Active is a wearable micro-dehumidifier that decreases core humidity by up to 40%. It creates a dry localized environment around your upper torso and thus enhances your comfort level while you engage in activities. Dry-Active sits comfortably over your shoulders and instantly enhances the performance of any water resistant or water proof jacket you choose to wear.  
The Dry-Active App
Monitor and Control your Environment
    The Dry-Active system comes with an App that will allow you to control the humidity settings that are monitored within your jacket. With any Smart Phone or Bluetooth device, you can operate the device or monitor temperature and humidity readings. You can even set it on Auto Pilot to turn on when moisture levels rise, and then off again when the desired comfort levels are reached.
Why do our bodies feel more uncomfortable in higher humidity?
The rate at which sweat evaporates depends on how much water is already in the air. Body temperatures increase in humid regions as the body's natural cooling process (thermoregulation) is impaired.
"If skin temperature is greater than that of the surroundings, the body can lose heat... But, if the temperature of the surroundings is greater than that of the skin, the body actually gains heat by radiation and conduction. In such conditions, the only means by which the body can rid itself of heat is by evaporation...Anything that prevents evaporation will cause the internal body temperature to rise... Humidity affects thermoregulation by limiting sweat evaporation..." - wikipedia.org
Dry-Active is held in place with an adjustable 3 strap system
Accelerates the removal of moisture caused by heat and sweat
A recent study has shown special clothing meant to wick moisture away from the skin is in reality, ineffective for the following reasons:
Moisture can accumulate in quantities that won't move through the fabric fast enough. 
When environmental humidity is as high as the humidity around your body, there is no capacity for the fabric to absorb additional vapour.
Fabrics can become saturated with water from excess rain and humidity.  When moisture also accumulates from the inside of this jacket (body heat & sweat), this newly formed moisture cannot pass through these saturated spots and becomes trapped.
DRY-ACTIVE'S System actively circulates air around your upper body and at the same time - takes away the moisture inside your jacket.
DRY-ACTIVE keeps your body temperature more consistent in cold weather too!
As we have learned, high humidity interferes with the body's cooling abilities.  In colder weather, wet fabrics sitting against the skin will transfer the cold from the surrounding environment.  This will lead to a drop in your body temperature.  Just think of how much colder a cool breeze feels on wet skin as opposed to when you are dry.  By keeping your clothing drier, our system will prevent this additional cooling effect for a more consistent experience.
The Dry-Active Solution
Dry-Active draws the moisture from underneath your jacket and runs it through our filter. Because the moisture is collected, your clothes stay dry and any cold transfer is prevented. The end result is a drier, more comfortable experience in any activity you choose to participate in.

Our Press:
Thank you for sharing our story!
The Data
Our studies have shown Dry-Active keeps your body in a recommended comfort zone. This is achieved by regulating your comfort levels away from uncomfortably moist, while also preventing you from feeling uncomfortably dry.  In our studies, improvements of up to 40% are experienced.
  Any level above "60" (humidity) places the body in discomfort. Top line is without Dry-Active. Bottom line within comfort zone is with our system
Technical Details

Features
Front Diagram
Diagram (Back)
Ergo Soft Support Sample Material
Wear
  PLAY

Click our video to see how Dry-Active sits under your jacket.
2 adjustable shoulder straps and 1 adustable waist belt secures Dry-Active in place
Maintenance

Maintenance is easy.
Each Dry-Active Device comes with a refillable filter that uses common low-cost materials found in your local hardware store.  Watch our short maintenance video below.
PLAY

Simply remove the old cartridge, rinse with cool water, dry and refill it with any number of recommended materials.  A full cartridge can usually last a whole day.  One time use cartridges may also be purchased from our website.
Who is Dry-Active for?
Construction / Utility Workers, Traffic Control,  Landscapers and more...
Whether you work in warmer or colder temperatures, Dry-Active ensures that your body is not adversely affected by excessive moisture inside your jacket.  
When heat is combined with other stresses such as hard physical work, loss of fluids, and fatigue may occur.  It may lead to heat-related illness, disability and even worse!  Dry-Active compliments with other heat stress prevention techniques to help our outdoor working warriors and ensures a more comfortable experience throughout your activity.
Bicycle commuters 
You can generate a good amount of sweat by pedalling for 10 miles.  On days where you don't want to look like you just came out of a sauna, Dry-Active is your best friend.
Skier and snowboarders
Having fun on the slopes generates different degrees of exertion at different times.  Need to hike for 5 minutes to get to that perfect spot?  Try sitting on a 15 minute long chairlift in the cold right after.  Moisture in your jacket makes you feel colder, faster!
Unless you are on a treadmill or a stationary bike, no single jacket can fully accommodate the varying exertion levels of any given activity.  When you are working harder than what your jacket can handle, you need that extra help.  With Dry-Active, you can automatically regulate the humidity levels in your jacket, so you feel more comfortable and dry.
Other Activities
Fishing, Hiking, Travel, even riding a scooter during a monsoon :-) ... basically anytime a jacket is required but the activity is causing you to sweat inside. We'd love to hear how you're using Dry-Active.

Timeline
Timeline
  Images of Initial Working Prototypes
Evolution of an idea...previous prototypes refined over the years!
The Dry-Active Team
Marco Tozzini:  Marco grew up dreaming of being an engineer. He took his first electronic course in elementary school where he built his first computer. Realizing this dream, he now brings more than 20 years of experience in Industrial Automation, Robotics and Telecom Design in both hardware and software technologies.

Lawrence Liu:  Lawrence is passionate about new technologies and has dedicated a career in launching cutting edge products to companies located all over the world.  He has over 15 years of Business Development and Marketing experience specifically promoting internet driven hardware and software technologies. 

Francis Ling: Francis has held CFO and Director positions for several private and public companies. He brings with him 4 decades of experience in financial and strategic management, including start-ups in the high tech and communications industries.

Piero Ciardi: With 30 years of experience in Mechanical Design, Piero's background includes mechanical design for home appliances, PC's and monitors and includes projects in the railway, radio and radar industries.
Alan Chuang: Alan has over 5 years of product management and planning experience in consumer electronics and holds an engineering degree in electronics.  He brings his experience in sourcing and managing contracts with design and manufacturing partners overseas. 
Francesco Pasquinelli: Francesco has 30 years of international trading and logistics operations experience.
Why We Need Your Help
We want to make a great product even better.  A portion of the proceeds from Kickstarter will go towards further improvements in design, wearability and performance.  Majority of the funding is being allocated towards production, certification manufacturing, delivery and industrial design.  

Industrial Design - Improvements on wearability, usability and comfort.
Software - Enhancements in our App offering
Certification - Possible approvals for performance situations.

campaign.story:
For several years, we have been exploring a wide range of pet leash designs, testing prototypes and researching high tech materials that can be durable and allow our new Leash Tamer™ to outperform traditional leash options. We wanted to produce the most versatile and functional, lightweight, non-tangle leash to replace retractable, bungee, and fixed leashes with one simple product.
What else?…. years of walking our dogs and being frustrated by the available leash options. Other than some minor improvements, there really haven’t been any leash innovations in years. Our challenge was to find the right combination of design and materials to provide a versatile, simple, non-mechanical leash, which lets you and your dog enjoy a hands-free walk together. 
There are many leashes on the market today, but our Leash Tamer™ outperforms them all. When we design multi-function products, we feel very strongly that each of the functions must perform BETTER than the single-function products being replaced. We know you don't want a product that provides three mediocre functions. 
The Leash Tamer is the best leash you will ever own. It is perfect for any situation! Whether you are in the city, suburbs or country, the Leash Tamer works perfectly. With a simple clip, you can set it to be a 3 foot, 6 foot, or 10 foot long leash. And because it retracts so effortlessly, it will never get tangled under your dog's feet. 
Even the handle has been re-designed to help it stay on your wrist even when you are not paying attention or grabbing the leash. It has a very gentle stretch so it softly snugs up around your wrist without being tight. 
We also offer our custom Carry Bag that can be easily clipped on to the Leash Tamer to hold your smart phone, some money, or some extra doggie bags! The Carry Bag comes in two colors: Black and Metal. 
The Leash Tamer™ has been designed and tested with all types of dog sizes and weights. We have spent years researching and developing designs and materials in order to meet the demanding objectives. We've incorporated that research into a simple to use product that provides all of the functionality of current leashes.
There are two sizes:
Small dogs: Under 25 lbs
Large dog: Over 25 lbs
Single Leash Tamer™ Rewards
 Multiple Leash Tamers™
Contact us if you are interested in larger quantities/bulk orders and we can add appropriate awards.
COLOR CHOICES:
We will be producing 3 colors of leashes in each of the two sizes (larger and small dogs). We want to give our collective supporters the ultimate choice of which colors are produced. Below are the color choices to pick from. At the end of the project supporters your input and vote will be gathered (along with shipping information) and we will produce the top 3 color picks for each leash size.
Small Dog Leash Color Choices:
Large Dog/Pet Leash Color Choices:

At Nootools, we “make everyday life simpler" and we make things work with simple, intuitive, functional designs. 
Nootools is a Connecticut-based company founded by a one-time physics major, Mark Noonan, who, along with the company Engineer Stephen Fog, have over 50 years combined experience designing, developing, engineering and branding new products. Before launching Nootools, we designed and developed products for some of the world’s leading companies - with many US and international awards and recognitions (including Time Magazine's Best Inventions for our Snow Wolf). Together we have over 30 patents and have started and built several brands from early inception. 
We can give you these commitments: all our products will work well, be made well, and whenever possible, made in the USA. We have deep experience with every aspect of the manufacturing process and supply chain. We have a track record of success and are absolutely committed to integrity, excellence and innovation. 
Examples of our products we invented and brought to market:
The Snow Wolf: a radically different approach to snow removal 
Our Leaf Loader: a nearly universal solution to all leaf and yard cleanup. 
Raxstars:  low-cost universal ski, snowboard and kayak adapters for ANY vehicle roof sport rack. 
We focus incessantly on improving and simplifying our designs and construction, to produce the most reliable, simplest operation for our products. We are committed to making products that work to improve and simplify your life, but we are just as focused on creating well-built, durable products without flaws! Our track record in delivering flawless products to our customers is nearly perfect because we stand behind all our products 100%. 
We also would like to thank Nellie, our shelter dog who , being part terrier and not a large dog is really the inspiration for the Leash Tamer™ with her perpetual exploration and deviating from any path to investigate the many scents and animals on our daily walks“…to Nellie the shelter dog.. .
One of our strongest skill sets overall is bringing well-made products to market smoothly. The core part of that is planning, anticipating potential production and customer issues and developing simple reliable solutions and production plans (foremost a design that is functionally optimized/simplified yet that accommodates a smooth and reliable production cycle). We have already been refining a very precise and novel production sequencing with one of our tested US-based manufacturing partners – creating the many prototypes and samples by testing and proving out the best of a range of approaches. 
The project is planned to be completed and shipped by end of April.We’ll have you enjoying your early spring walks.. that is our commitment! 
The tooling unfortunately comprises 10 weeks, as the production cycle for building that type of injection-molded tool is currently a bit back-logged (including testing and production setup) to complete after the project is funded. 
As touched on, we are very hands on (and very experienced in managing sourcing and production sequencing) when we choose products to produce and manufacture, as we will be for the Leash Tamer – to ensure it is not just made with high quality materials, but well built to last. 
Setting up the production flow, fixtures and overall process is central to delivering and quality product - and , while we are very efficient and capable in this regard, this is a critical step for any new product production (to develop the step-by-step production and fabrication step) and to create simple fixtures (specific to our product and components) for the factory team to work from. 
Production run (4 weeks), as it would start slow with higher percentage of quality control sampling before speeding up daily production then adding/training additional production teams.  
Please Join Us to 'Kickstart' the Leash Tamer™ ….
We are very pleased to be launching Kickstarter and really appreciate both your interest and support in our goal to bring products to you that save time and simplify your life. Please show your support by making a pledge to receive your Leash Tamer™ or as a gift to a fellow pet lover. We hope you will spread the word and help us raise enough to put Leash Tamer into production. Our thanks to you and your four-footed friends.. We would also greatly appreciate if everyone would share the Kickstarter project link with a friend.
Your generous pledge will go directly towards helping us fund the costs of the production engineering, sizable tooling for the injection-mold, raw materials, final packaging design, shipping and the first production run. Any funds received beyond that will be well used for the further development of our brand and two additional planned Leash Tamer™ brand products.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In order to amortize and cover the tooling and setup costs, we need to reach a minimum production of roughly 1600 units. The manufacturing and tooling is fairly straightforward and low volume tooling and production has already been successfully tested. The current design has been worked through by our team and will have only minor tweaks in the final tooling/design. 

We have filed our patent and it is now pending. There are minor risks related to staying on schedule rather than risks to successfully delivering finished products. While the fabrics and hardware component suppliers have already been sourced, there is always some possibility that once we deliver the final engineering designs for the injection molding, the company doing our tool building may have slightly longer backlogs and lead times which could somewhat delay our production. Similarly, while we have built in what we think is prudent scheduling with our final fabricator/assembler, unplanned new production projects could possibly delay final production and delivery . Nonetheless, anticipating ,planning for, and managing the many hundreds of minor production issues is a major focus for us and one that we are committed to delivering a timely and high quality product to our supporters and customers. 

Should the project be well over-subscribed, that might add at most a couple weeks, merely from just the greater production volume requiring a bit more production time.

Our team has one of the best product designers with a very strong background in design for manufacturing. Even if we encounter high demand, we will be able to scale production and logistics accordingly. We believe that we will start shipping to our supporters starting April 2015 or maybe even a bit earlier if we can. See more detail above. We will keep you close in the loop of our latest developments.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
